Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY SATISIFIED above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: casper684
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC! Had 2 bedroom suite with grandkids. It was great. Comfy beds, roomy suite and the kitchen came in very handy due to gluten free diet. ONLY minor minus was the pool. In all fairness it was as advertised "cool". BUT hot tub and children's 3 foot deep pool were warmer. Whole Foods store not terribly far away so we had plenty of food. They even offered a "manager's reception" in the evening providing a lovely salad bar for free AND breakfast was also free and looked delicious. Had some gluten free options too so that was nice. Bonus of allowing pets. Enjoyed seeing well behaved dogs :-) Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad not great”
Reviews.Author: lhymowitz
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: location - walking distance from space needle, EMP, monorail, lake Union staff - professional if not friendly downside - felt like a lower quality hotel than a residence inn food - average to awful coffee - bad overall not bad but not great. Pool was fine for kids but ground very slippery.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families”
Reviews.Author: Kitkat1961
Reviews.Content: This property is great for the family, close to Seattle.Center. Staff is friendly and accommodating. They also have free breakfast every morning with lots to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: joelikes2travel
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn Seattle Downtown/Lake Union is a great place to stay when traveling to Seattle. The hotel provides a good breakfast, it is clean, and has a paid parking garage ($23 per day). The Seattle Streetcar runs in front of the hotel for easy access to local attractions. For a higher room rate, you can get a room with a view of the lake. It is pleasant to see float planes taking off and landing, along with the numerous sail boats cruising the lake. All rooms come with a refrigerator, microwave oven and range top.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to public transportation and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingProducer
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of girlfriends at this hotel over the weekend. Most of us had our own rooms, but I shared a 2 Bedroom/2 Bath Suite with one friend. Not only did we each have total privacy, but the price was only $50 more than the 1 Bedroom or Studio, making it a huge deal when you split it. The hotel is about a block away from the Lake Union Trolley, which takes you to the heart of downtown in just a few minutes for the bargain price of $2.50 (which we had much confusion about whether we really needed to pay, since no one checks tickets). Our room didn't face the lake or anything, but it was quiet and had the usual amazingly comfortable Marriott bed. (And all of the rooms have balconies, which is nice to get some fresh air, even without a view) The complimentary breakfast was definitely up to Residence Inn standards with a waffle station and eggs plus rotating side dishes daily. The free WiFi is not the fastest in the world, but it was consistent and is free. We did not use the overnight parking. My only complaint is the front desk staff seems poorly trained and not as customer-focused as I have experienced in other Residence Inns or Marriott Properties as a rule. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to fellow travelers as a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Consistency on Lake Union (with a catch)”
Reviews.Author: genway53
Reviews.Content: WIth the expectation that a chain suite hotel gets it right through repetition, then Residence Inn Seattle Downtown doesn't dissapoint. (and in fact my pre-teen son ebulliently gave it "the best hotel" we've ever stayed-in award). With the standard elements of predictable architecture, decor and inclusive breakfast done quite well, the enhancements are a marvelous view of Lake Union (a much appreciated upgrade) and great location for exploring all that funky Seattle has to offer. The benefits are that the room rates are competitive and certainly better than the overpriced and bloated full amenity hotels up the street. The frontdesk staff are helpful and efficient if not over-friendly. Downsides are that the underground parking is a complete rip-off. There is only very limited overnight street parking and a near construction zone limits this further. So the $28 per night incl tax charge was both exhorbitant and entirely unjustifiable. (And to add insult we had the tire caps stolen off our car in the garage overnight.) The "fitness center" equipment is a little tired and worn but sufficient. The bathroom plumbing also had some problems with a slow-draining bath-tub. Overall it's likely we would consider this property for a future stay but without a hire car next time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: Sue K
Reviews.Content: We always enjoying staying here even though our Seattle trips are not for enjoyment but medical. Staff is attentive & I have to give credit to our housekeeper who did a great job even with her fear of dogs (we have two large dogs 70 & 100 lbs that go everywhere with us). Mary at the front desk is great and even managed a kiss out of Monna (which is rare from her);~) Kathy is always helpful to me when when I for reservations and goes the extra mile to make sure all of our needs will be met before we get there. We go every 3 to 6 months and will not stay anywhere else. We are able to relax here after a long day of either traveling to Seattle or sitting at the clinic. If we have our grandchildren with us we can take them swimming to unwind. There are laundry facilities, weight room, pool, hot tub, and a sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel for Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Ukelele67
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a 2 bedroom suite (2 bathrooms and a kitchenette). It's in a good location and there's an inexpensive streetcar nearby that you can take into the heart of downtown (I chose to leave the car at the hotel...parking there is $23/day so if you then also park downtown you've spent a heap on parking). The room price includes a good breakfast in the lobby dining area (it closes at 9:30am during the week and i caution against arriving much after 9 because the hotel staff will not put out more of the main course stuff once it runs out - as it seems to around 9:10 or so). I think most evenings there's a light dinner - salad and baked baked potato bar that is also free and not advertised. There's a pool, hot tub, gym. Wifi in our room was free too but very slow. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Inn-stantly likeable”
Reviews.Author: TravellerPlus
Reviews.Content: Rooms for five adults aren't the norm, but the Residence Inn had accommodation that suited us perfectly. The bedrooms and washrooms were a good size, the small sitting room and dining area meant we didn't need to stay in our bedrooms, and we made good use of the kitchen. Beds were comfortable, and I liked that we could choose the type of pillows we wanted at the time of booking. Breakfast was tasty with plenty of choice, but the dining area can be crowded at times. Staff at Reception were friendly and helpful, giving us good advice about where to go for a quick meal near the hotel. One of my friends liked the hotel so much she's booked it for a stay later this year; I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “House on the Lake”
Reviews.Author: jay r
Reviews.Content: I regularly join my wife on business trips up to Seattle for a change of scenery and to check in on clients I also have in the area. We stay at the Residence Lake Union exclusively for good reason. It is our dog Jo's favorite hotel. Really. He loves to travel and the staff now know him as a frequent guest. The best part is the pet charge is only $10. But seriously, this property feels like a getaway in the heart of one of the world's great cities. Easy to find, comfortable and clean, the Lake Union is a welcoming place that puts Seattle at your fingertips. Don't confuse this Marriott on Lake Union, with the Courtyard Marriott on Lake Union. We have stayed at the Courtyard and it is not the same caliber. We actually pass right by it with the dog on our morning runs around the lake. It looks tired compared to the Residence. The trolley also run right outside the door at the Residence, for the quick trip downtown without having to hassle with parking. There is great food steps from the hotel, some right on the lake. Serafina and Pasta Freska are both close and four-star Italian restaurants. The hotel has their breakfast bar and evening snack and wine tastings which are better than average, but for a great breakfast head up Eastlake to Louisa's Bakery and Cafe. The corner rooms have bigger decks with great views of the lake and north skyline. The kitchens make it easy to eat in. We make a stop at Whole Foods or PCC Market over in Ballard and stock up on finger foods to go with a glass of NW wine or beer out on the deck. We even invite local friends over and entertain because It is all too easy, like having your on house on the lake...

Reviews.Title: “When I return to Seattle, I will only stay here”
Reviews.Author: RckStr511
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week last Feb. 2011, on business, loved it! Very comfortable and beautiful; the rooms seemed to have been recently renovated with tons of space. Bed was extremely comfortable, I looked forward to it each night. If I didn't feel like being in my room, the lobby area was grand with many areas to hang out and get some work done, or relax to the sound of the large fountain in the center. I also enjoyed its location; there were great restaurants right across the street, it had a beautiful view of Lake Union, and even though this hotel is in the city... It's just on the outskirts of downtown enough that you do not feel crammed or have an issue with getting in and out. The first day I was there, I literally walked right out of the hotel and walked the entire city easily... Right down to Pike Place Market in no time! Another interesting thing you could take part in when i was there, was "renting a roommate". For somewhere around $5 you can choose a Beta Fish to live in your room during your stay... The money goes to the local children's hospital, wonderful concept. And you do not have to lift a finger... They bring it in the room and take it away at the end of your stay; also the housekeeper feeds it each day. When I return to Seattle, I will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, the reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: sclarklaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Residence Inn for an overnight stay and wished I could have stayed longer. I asked for a feather free room and they accommodated my request and acknowledged it upon check in. The bed was so comfortable that I didn't want to wake up and get going. I had a suite on the 3rd floor with a view of the Space Needle and Lake Union, the only drawback was that the street noise was loud. Maybe the rooms on the other side of the hotel are quieter but maybe not because they are so close to I-5. The parking garage is also hard to navigate and the spaces are super narrow. I would stay here again, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still very nice!”
Reviews.Author: B1Brian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 nights a week for the last couple months, so this is an update. The hotel remains my choice place to stay here in Seattle. Very easy access to all the prime venues in town. The parking is secure and covered. Easy access to a nearby Whole Foods market and there is a Safeway on Queen Anne about 10 minutes away. If you get a room on the lake side, you get great views of the boats and lake. The rooms are far superior to older Res Inns. Rooms are very clean although surfaces (tables, counters) could be cleaner. Staff is GREAT! Very helpful. Monday's are soup and salad, Tuesday is something a little heavier (like baked potatoes), and Wednesdays seem to be BBQ stuff. All very good. Breakfast is also free and is excellent with all kinds of tasty stuff. Free newspapers (local, McPaper, and WSJ). Appears to be pet friendly since there are often leashed dogs around. I have never heard a dog bark, though, and have never smelled "dog" smells, so it is OK. See you there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Cathu-john
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the first time, but I have never seen a wonderful service like this before. The rooms, are very clean, nice view of space niddle. It was only a 20 minutes ride from the airport, with United Limo, they were refered by the Front desk as a car service. In case you need the number [--]. Only $38. Over all I was very happy, and difently stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well maintained, Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: tjmambo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night in a 1 bdr. suite with our teenager and toddler. We had to order a roll away but there was plenty of room and separation for all of us to feel comfortable. The room was clean, the housekeeping staff were very responsive, and we all slept well. I was suprised at how quiet the room was. The swimming pool and gym seem quite small for a hotel this size. The breakfast was adequate and offered plenty of choices. Parking in the garage is a very tight squeeze. We wondered how you'd get an SUV out of there. We didn't try them, but I noticed there were dining options directly across from the entrance that looked appealing. We would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Diamond_D
Reviews.Content: I was staying only 1 night for an interview at Fred Hutchinson next door, and I was blown away by the quality of service by the staff. I had to store my bags downstairs several times since I arrived early the first day and left late the next. By the afternoon on day 1 the desk clerk knew my name, wished me luck on the interview, and made sure everyone else on duty knew to take care of my bags for me. Rooms were clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was plentiful. The location is great, a quick walk to a free sailboat tour of Lake Union (Center for Wooden Boats) and steps to the light rail to downtown. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodations for our family of four”
Reviews.Author: sjst1000
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a week-long stay at this Residence Inn during a recent trip to visit family in the area. This hotel was perfect for us - excellent location to downtown Seattle, huge room that allowed our family to spread out and have the personal space necessary for a week away from home :c) We booked a 2 bed/2 bath and were lucky enough to get a room that had a huge balcony that overlooked Lake Union. It was beautiful! The rooms and common areas were all clean and upscale. The staff at the front desk was not the most helpful at times, I'm afraid, and the free breakfast in the mornings left a ton to be desired. But overall, if we did this trip again, we would definitely stay at this Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Seattle Stay”
Reviews.Author: buffettbabe
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Residence Inn/Lake Union and I wanted to see if it could possibly top the last visit...it did! This is a great hotel to stay and still be within the city confines, but an easy escape out of the city too. The streetcar stop is right across the street, and there are restaurants all within walking distance. It is great for families as the accommodations are outstanding and the breakfast buffet was fantastic. All of the staff are also outstanding and very attentive and friendly. I won't stay anywhere else in Seattle now!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dalotek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for New Years. It is in walking distance to the Space Needle and also close to the streetcar which brings you to downtown Seattle. Not too far to walk either. Great suites, kitchen, extra living room and bedroom. Fridge, stove, microwave, coffeemaker. Breakfast is to die for. Lots of options to choose from. Just don't wait till the last minute to get there. Hot tub and heated swimming pool. Minus: Too many kids were hogging it, even at 11PM on New Years eve. It was a bit much and lots of kids in there, did not see the parents... We felt welcome there, nice lay-out of hotel. No bar for a late drink. You have to go across the street. Parking - an issue. We were waiting in line to pull in. Then, at check-in, we were presented wit a hefty $23 parking bill. which totaled somewhere in the $28 area with all the taxes. No comps for handicapped parking. There were only three small spaces in the front. Something you might want to consider before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things about the Residence Inn Seattle/Lake Union!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTarmale
Reviews.Content: My husband, two young children and I stayed here in december 2011. Upon arrival we were very nicely greeted even though it was around 11pm at night. We stayed in a one bedroom room which was the size of an apartment! The bedroom had a huge king bed with the softest mattress cover and a large flat screen tv. The living room was also very large and had a pull out sofa and chair with another large (I think about 42') flat screen tv, a balcony with a view of the lake and a nice size kitchen with a full size refigerator and a dishwasher. Breakfast was served every morning and there was a huge selection. Now granted, it's not the ritz and it was very carb-heavy as some people had mentioned but it is, afterall, free. On some evenings there was even a managers reception with again a free dinner. Coffee and hot chocolate are available complimentary 24hours which the kids and I sure appreciated. We really enjoyed the pool on the third floor complete with a hot tub, sauna, gym, laundry room and nice large windows to look out of. There is also a baby/small child pool that is 3 feet deep that my kids enjoyed. Laundry facilities are on the same floor so we threw out clothes in the washer and when we got out of the pool put it in the dryer. Staff is extremely friendly including PJ, Erin, Jospeh and a woman who was 9 months pregnant (but I forgot her name). I know I'm not including everyone but they were all wonderful. The people who were working at the breakfast buffet didn't stop and there was NO texting whatsoever which, as a traveler, is a nice relief since we often see that. Another thing we loved-the parking garage is self service, you just use your room key to get in and out so there is no nonsense with valet parking and constant tipping which is very annoying. Streetcar station is right in front of the hotel and the city is only a couple of stops away. Seattle is a very small city so it's very walkable. We travel alot and this is the first time I've ever given a hotel 5 stars. It is more of a self service hotel but we like that. When in Seattle, you can't miss Pike Place Market. We had great meals at The Athenian and Delaurenti which has awesome sandwiches. Down the street is Beeches cheese with the best mac and cheese. The children's museum was alot of fun as well.

Reviews.Title: “Different type of Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: Levon M
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there while visiting our youngest son a number of times and it is the only hotel in that part of Seattle that we care to stay at. They have underground parking. It's a little pricy but there are not really any other options for parking. I have never seen a Residence Inn that looks like this one. In fact the first time we stayed there I asked at the reception desk if it had been originally built as something else and she told me no - it was a Residence Inn from the beginning. It looks more like an Embassy Suites then anything else. The rooms are large and well appointed. I believe the furniture was all replaced in the last 2-3 years. They have an excellant morning buffet breakfast and an afternoon Managers reception with light eats & drinks - all included in the price. The interior is a large atrium with all the rooms opening on the atrium. There are a number of good restaurants within a few minutes walking for supper.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: B1Brian
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple weeks and am very impressed with place. The reception area is nice and they have on-site, underground parking ($$), but given the crummy Seattle weather, that works real nice. Rooms are excellent and, if you stay on the lake side, you get nice views. Typical Marriott quality. Breakfast is really excellent. Evening receptions are also very nice. Really, no downsides except the expensive parking, but if you are a biz traveller, no Biggy. I plan on staying here for a good long time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzannah123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a shopping weekend with my sister. The room was a nice 1 bedroom with a fold out sofa and full kitchen. We faced the lake but didn't have a view because we weren't high enough. I had heard these rooms could be noisy because they faced the street, but we never found it too noisy. Thh lobby has a hugh atrium where snacks duriing the week and breakfast daily is served. It is nice because you are not all crammed into a tiny breakfast room like most hotels. The breakfast was good. We stopped in one night on the way back from shoopping and they were serving spaghetti and garlic toast and salad. It didn't look too appetizing so we passed on it. There is a trolly across the street that takes you to downtown shopping. We found it very handy. We were originally concerned about restaurants close by as we didn;t want to drive and were pleasently surprised at the choices of restaurants right across the street on the lakeshore. We had some great meals. All in all a wonderful hotel and I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff but post location.”
Reviews.Author: Selvestedansken
Reviews.Content: As with most of the Marriots the rooms are big, the staff friendly and the hotel clean. But location isn't the best. I was here on bussiness so for me it didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: SkiddersL
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Residence Inn at Lake Union/Seattle, WA. What attracted us to this hotel was the fact that they have two bedroom suites which others say they have but don't. The pictures of the room online also looked as though they have been recently renovated. We were traveling with two children as well. Overall this was a great hotel. They had a very nice complimentary breakfast every day with a nice variety. Three evenings they also had a light dinner, that our children enjoyed. The pool was nice and they have a seperate 3 foot pool for small children. This hotel was probably one of the most pet friendly hotels that I have ever seen. It actually seemed like my family was in the minority with out a pet. My only complaint was that our furniture in our living room (although newer) was very worn especially the chair. And there was a big stain in the middle of our carpet. Also the mattresses were horribly soft. I eventually got semi used to it. The kitchen was very nice and very nice to have a full size frig and microwave to cook some things for our children. Would definitely stay there again. Great location to get to airport, downtown, and suburbs. I did a lot of research on a room for a family of 5 staying for a week and The Residence Inn was definately the best game in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Katie P
Reviews.Content: Family of four with a 3 year old and a 10 month old. Everything about our 2 night stay here was great. We were upgraded from a one-room suite to a two-room suite with kitchen and living area, were given a high chair upon request and placed on the 3rd floor with easy access to pool and work-out room. The room was clean and well appointed with everything we needed, and there were no gross, never-cleaned bed spreads which was awesome! Beds were very comfortable and had many pillows of different softness and support levels. Internet was accessible and easy to use. We were able to have friends come visit for dinner and there was plenty of room and seating for everyone. The trolly was very conveniently located and easy to get to. The pool has a hot tub and a kiddie pool, the one minor complaint was that the pool was a bit on the chilly side. The included breakfast was great! Fresh eggs, a waffle bar, oatmeal, fruit, cereal..something for everyone and very tasty. The seating area was very clean and comfortable with a nice water feature for ambiance. Also, the weather cooperated, I am sure the hotel arranged this. :) Overall an excellent stay and we will definitely be back and recommend this to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjoconn
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. I enjoyed the free breakfast in the lobby every morning. Monday night is soup and salad night, tuesday is taco night, and wednesday is burger night. The staff was friendly and I was always greated pleasantly by housekeeping and front desk personnel. The room was large with a small kitchenette and full sized refrigerator. There is hotel parking, but if you are going downtown I recommend catching the light rail. there are 2 stoops within a 3 minute walk of the hotel and it will take you all the way to Westlake Mall. I highly recommend and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain for a Group or Family”
Reviews.Author: MagW
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a car to park, so without that issue, I have absolutely nothing but praise. We were 5 women on a birthday trip. We shared a suite with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, a huge kitchen, good sized living area, 3 televisions, separate thermostats, and a huge free breakfast buffet. It was very comfortable. The sofa bed was oddly comfortable. Service was efficient. The front desk was very helpful. Cab service was fantastic. The room rate split between 5 was crazy inexpensive. It isn't a "sexy" hotel like the Edgewater, but much more comfortable and affordable. It money is no object - go to the Edgewater. If you want a clean, comfortable bargain with a room you can hang out in without that "hotel room feeling", go to the Marriott Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beware "Priceline People"”
Reviews.Author: Rich984
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, rooms are nice and big. They have a full fridge, dishwasher, two flat screen tvs and two elements for cooking. Also, plates, pots, pans, ect. It's quiet. Free breakfast. Had an issue with the parking, below is part of my email to Marriott. I initially bid on a one night stay, after successfully winning the bid I was prompted to extend my stay. I was happy to do so after reviewing the location of the hotel, the free breakfast and most importantly the free parking. Because of the two separate reservations, I had to re-check in again for the second night, no big deal. When checking in for the second night I was asked if we had a car with us, which we did. We were informed of the 23 dollar parking fee. I mentioned to the front desk clerk, that it might be on file that I have an email from my successful bid that clearly states the parking was free. (We had the same issue the first night of check in, but I just showed my email and the free parking was granted) The front desk manager Jill took note of the situation and jumped in. Saying very loudly, “No, NO, NO! You Priceline People do NOT get free parking, never!” It was a little embarrassing to us, that we were being referred to, actually we were being yelled at for using Priceline for our reservation. We mentioned the free parking was one of our main reasons for extending our stay for two nights. Again we were reminded that us “Priceline People” do not ever get free parking . I asked if I should run up and get my phone (which had the email indicating free parking) to which Jill replied at a much louder voice than was required (since I was right in front of her) “yeah, but it won’t do you any good, Priceline People never ever get free parking.” And then something to the effect of “I’d like to see this email”. As I walked away to get my phone and my wife waited nearby, Jill continued to rant about the situation right in front of my wife as if she wasn’t standing there. This was getting very embarrassing for the both of us as there were lots of customers around because the morning breakfast was just wrapping up. I returned with my iPhone, showed the email, free parking was granted, although not without a few extra snarky comments from Jill. No apology, no thanks for being patient, no sorry for the confusion, nothing. Also, worth noting that we were put into a room without a balcony, not sure if that was further punishment for using Priceline. It clearly indicates online that all rooms have a private balcony. If your hotel wants to treat Priceline guest different than other guests, you should probably not make your hotel available to be booked through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great either! Parking was a real pain!”
Reviews.Author: rhanderson
Reviews.Content: On a recent pleasure trip to the Pacific Northwest My wife; another couple, we travel frequently with; and I stayed at the Residence Inn Seattle Downtown/Lake Union. This was our first days on a two week trip and we stayed 3 nights in this location. As we travel frequently as two couples, the two bedroom suites available at Residence Inns make a very convenient and economical choice of lodging for us.We found the Seattle stay to be both positive and negative. I'll start with the negative so I can end on the more positive side of the stay. To start, we tried to check in early (about 1:30 in the afternoon on Saturday) and were informed our room was not ready yet; this was quite understandable as the start of check in was listed for 4:00, but the front desk clerk asked for my cell phone number and said they would call when the room was available. So we proceeded to go downtown to the Pike Market. At about 3:30 I was called and informed our room was ready. We stayed about 20 more minutes at the market and then returned to the hotel. We got back to the Residence Inn at about 4:15 and tried to check in only to be informed that the room was not ready yet. I said that I had been called and told our room was ready and could read on the list we were supposed to be in a certain room number but the room we ended up with was a different number. I am sure that they had given the other room to somebody else that had arrived between the time we had been called and we had gotten back to the hotel. DON'T CALL IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO SAVE THE ROOM! The next problem arose right after check in when I tried to park the vehicle in parking garage. The vehicle we had was a full size SUV, but not the largest size one. The parking lot (supposedly made for larger vehicles) was almost filled and only about three spaces were left, and all were extremely small. I had to make 8 maneuvers to get the vehicle in the space, and all the passengers had to get out before getting into the space because you could not open the doors of the vehicle once you were parked. I had to climb out of the back hatch door once I was parked! I know that the hotel probably has to have a minimum number of parking spots under law,but come on lets expand the size of these spaces so people can actually park and get out of their vehicle! The room itself was good size, comfortable, and very functional, but the chairs and the ottoman were quite worn. On the positive side I thought the beds were comfortable. The gym was clean, had good equipment, and was well stocked with towels. The complimentary breakfast was very good and the atrium was large enough to accommodate the large crowd at breakfast. We were busy seeing the sites of Seattle so we never got to partake in the receptions held in the early evenings at the hotel. After the initial problem with the room, the front desk personnel were quite helpful and knowledgeable. The best thing of all was the convenient location especially the trolley stop right in front of the hotel which made getting downtown a breeze especially since once parked I did not want to move the vehicle again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: phoenixgirl2
Reviews.Content: I was so happy to be able to stay here as the location was pretty great. It was right next to a trolley stop, although the trip there from the airport (without a car) was a little trickier. The room was beautiful and the bed was super comfortable. The customer service was excellent as well, and the breakfast was fine for a hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in recent stay”
Reviews.Author: delapNorthwest
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and really enjoyed it. This time the hotel was showing it's wear and tear. The chairs and ottomons were all beat up and looked like they were from the local Salvation Army store. The plants all had dust on them too. It was very quiet for sleeping and beds comfortable. The breakfast is pretty good. For the price though, the furniture should be in good condition and the hotel totally clean.

Reviews.Title: “A gem, especially for pet owners”
Reviews.Author: faura
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. We needed a temporary home for 2-3 weeks after some flooding in our house, and this turned out to be a welcoming and very comfortable surrogate. The staff were kind and friendly, and very good with our two dogs. Some of the younger and newer staff were a little befuddled at the registration desk, leading to longer than necessary delays, but that was easily forgiven. There is a large lobby/breakfast area. Breakfast had a lot of variety and they tried to have slightly different hot items every day. The room was decent - clean and well-maintained. A fire alarm went off in the hotel one night, and that caused one of our dogs to have an accident in the living room area. We felt terrible about it, but the housekeeping staff was very sympathetic and helped clean it up. There's a dog park nearby. It's a gravel and pebble park, not grass or dirt. But, it's useful to have something so close by. The location is very good. Walking distance to downtown, or you can take the S.L.U.T. (South Lake Union Trolley). For those with cars, getting on and off I-5 is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spinnergrl
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here Oct 6-10. It is the perfect place to stay especially for a family with children. The staff was freindly and helpful. The beds were comfortable. Hot breakfast was served every morning and was delishous. Having the streetcar right outside the hotel was great also for getting downtown. $2.50 for an adult. I would defineately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay at a very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbtexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel for four nights in mid September. First of all, this is not your typical Residence Inn. It most apparently was not built as a Residence Inn and is somewhat larger than your typical Residence Inn. There is a large atrium lobby, and the staff / facility could handle the larger crowds at mealtime (breakfasts / evening "receptions" several nights per week). The only less than exceptional aspect of the hotel was the room servicing, where as a result of what both the front desk and we considered to be a "language" issue, our room was not serviced one day. We also found stick pins on the floor from a previous guest, and we did not have toiletries restocked one day. Other than that, the experience was very good. Front desk staff were helpful, and polite, but efficient. Of note, I was not acknowledged as an elite member of Marriott Rewards. We were in room 510, overlooking Fairview Avenue. With the balcony door open, the street noise was noticeable, but otherwise, street noise was not a problem, although during daytime hours, the street is fairly heavily traveled. The location is exceptional - although one big warning on that - see below. The location is about one mile north of downtown Seattle. In the immediate vicinity is South Lake Union Park and a number of reasonably upscale restaurants. To get a cheaper meal, one would have to walk a bit. There is excellent public transport immediately in front of the hotel - both the streetcar and the 70-73 bus lines (at least one line is running at all times, with frequent service to both downtown and the University of Washington). It is also possible and apparently safe to walk from the hotel to the center of Seattle (we did it multiple times in daylight without any worries - note that two blocks of Terry north of Denny do not have sidewalks - use Westlake instead). It is also a reasonably flat route - particularly on Westlake. Note also that the streetcar does not run very late into the evening many nights, if you plan an evening in downtown Seattle. The hotel would make an exceptionally good choice for a long term stay for a family of a cancer patient at the neighboring Fred Hutchinson Cancer Care Center or someone relocating to one of the nearby large employers. As much as we enjoyed our stay, I must warn of upcoming construction closures for the Mercer Corridor Project. Check progress on www.seattle.gov and then search for Mercer Corridor Project. For those planning on using an automobile to venture out from the Residence Inn, check the site for planned closures. The detour routes make staying in downtown Seattle or an outlying area a more viable choice, in my view. Also, check for bus detours / route changes / stop changes. In my limited experience with some bus stop changes at the University of Washington, King County Metro does a reasonable job of placing signs at the affected stops, but does not update their web site (that I could tell). This construction will continue into 2013. Again, this is most likely to impact someone planning to use an auto to get around from the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for single traveler”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaBeebo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week ending 9/16/11. There is both a streetcar stop and a bus stop right outside the hotel, which was critical for me since I was on foot and by public transport only this trip. Lake Union is just across the street and that is a huge plus. The hotel is worn but very, very clean. Breakfast buffet excellent and includes fresh fruit, eggs, breakfast meat, lots of choices. Pool, sauna, exercise room all in good condition. Manager's reception Monday through Wednesday, nice, but they hit you up for donations if you want beer or wine, which I thought was tacky. No airport shuttle to this location, but you can hire a car from the airport or, for the brave and fit, lug your luggage on the Metro and then hire a car from the station. The front desk is staffed largely with bland twentysomethings who are friendly but will not go out of their way. It's important to keep asking if you want something. Example: Several times I needed to find the right bus route (Seattle transit, God love 'em, was frequently out of route maps.) The staff has access to Google maps and is typically happy to print them for you and was good about doing that -- if you get the right staff member. One morning, I asked the correct route for the U-District. The first twentysomething I asked said she wasn't familiar with the bus system but I could go into the business center and Google the info. I changed lines at the desk and the second clerk immediately offered to print me a Google map. So, keep asking. Most of the staff is very good, but again, the desk is staffed by kids making probably $8 an hour and appear to have no supervision. They do excellent work considering all that. Don't let them tell you that the Space Needle is within walking distance. The way they tell you is only if you want to walk through heavy construction and folks asking for money. There is a back way, which I figured out through one of the maps available in the free brochures, but you have to be willing to study the map.

Reviews.Title: “Dog Friendly Seattle In-City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FromPacficNW
Reviews.Content: The location in Seattle's South Lake Union area is good, easy to get downtown, several Lake front restaurants walkable, and close to some major medical facilities which is why we were here. The rooms have good cooking facilities and are spacious for longer stays. We needed a place that would let us bring our dog, and this Residence Inn allows pets, and doesn't make a huge deal about it. There is a $10 per night surcharge and a few common sense rules for bringing your pet. Parking is $21 per night which is a little steep, since the neighboring Silver Cloud has free parking. For us the pet friendly policy trumped the parking charge. Hotel has a more than adequate free breakfast buffet, and daily newspaper delivered to room for Marriott rewards members. Free wi-fi too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect way to share room with grown children”
Reviews.Author: JennyGW
Reviews.Content: We first booked a one bedroom suite thinking that the bedroom would be closed off with it's own door. This wasn't the case and though the room was large with a king bed and fold out couch. Large bathroom and full kitchen. The privacy wasn't there. The hotel was full so we stayed one night and checked to see if they had something bigger. We were moved to a 2 bedroom suite and for the cost difference from $180 to $230 the extra money was very much worth the extra bedroom with 2 queen beds and extra bath. Both bedrooms were closed off from the living space in between with kitchen, table fold out sofa and chairs and table. We even had a small balcony with two chairs. Perfect for our family of four with 2 adult sons. The hotel is within walking distance to the Seattle Center and we were able to walk to Bumbershoot and avoid the parking hassle. The hotel is also located across the street from Chandler's Seafood restaurant; a favorite of ours and we were able to watch the seaplanes take off.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all the way around !”
Reviews.Author: 2go
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days in a 2 bedroom suite. It was comfortable, roomy, quiet and we had a great view of the lake from our balcony. The weather was perfect and our stay was great! The complimentary hot breakfast was great and there something for everyone. This a dog-friendly hotel and I loved seeing all of man's best friends coming and going out of the hotel with their owners. There is a trolley that runs right outside the front of the hotel and takes you downtown. It was great! Customer service was great and helpful. GREAT PLACE! and good value!

Reviews.Title: “Great place , would return any time”
Reviews.Author: brendat54
Reviews.Content: We have travelled world wide, and stayed in many high priced places , this hotel is great and very comfortable, easy access to transit and freeway, this could easily become my most favourite hotel , The suite are roomy and comfortable, the only thing is that the bathroon could be bigger, BUT REALLY who spends much time in one, Thankyou Residence Inn for a great time, if we are back inSeattle , we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent"”
Reviews.Author: westvaner
Reviews.Content: This is are second time here and the rooms were large and the breakfast was outstanding. Good value all around!

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great value”
Reviews.Author: toodycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise to Alaska. This is a great hotel. It is a former Embassy Suites and the lobby is consistent with the Embassy atrium look. We were upgraded to a two bedroom suite with two baths and a magnificent balcony, overlooking the Seattle downtown and the Space Needle. One bedroom had two double beds and the other had a king size bed. The living room included a sofa bed and the kitchen had all the amenities you would require for making quick meals while traveling. We didn't do any cooking. However, there was a little market in the lobby which sold basic, instant items. Also, guests can get pizza delivered. We ate dinner across the street at Duke's Chowder House which was pretty good although the service was a bit slow. Breakfast is included in the room rate. There were eggs, English muffins, fruit and cereals. The hotel is nicely situated if you wish to walk around the lake. I would definitely recommend the Residence Inn to anyone looking for reasonable, comfortable accommodations in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Thought could trust Marriott name - wrong!”
Reviews.Author: C B
Reviews.Content: Planned last 4 nights of a month long vacation for this property. Wanted some quiet space to just relax, organize for the trip back home. Called ahead to confirm would have room with good view as planned to spend time in room enjoying. Terribly disappointed when arrived (Fri - 5 PM) to look out to view of street and parking lot. Immediately asked for another room -- they refused to change as said they were going to be full -- but it was obvious many many had not checked in yet -- could have changed, but did not want to bother. Furnishings were dingy, room hot - had to replace thermostat in room second day; returned to room one evening after long day in city to find room had not been cleaned. Just over all - not what you expect as a loyal Marriott Rewards member. Do not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SPN_11
Reviews.Content: I live in Seattle, but I use this hotel often. I like it a lot. Several years ago, I stayed at this hotel during my job interview and my moving to Seattle, and I liked it. After I started to live in Seattle, I still use this hotel on many occasions. For example, when my parents in law visit Seattle, they stay here with us (my house is too small)). Rooms are clean and spacious. Our kids like the swimming pool. I like the sports gym. We all like their breakfast. They do not have any restaurant (for dinner) inside, but there are many good restaurants across the street. The hotel sometimes (not everyday) offers free dinner in the lobby, which is great. They offer free Wi-Fi, but the connection is sometimes very slow and frustrating. This is the only one complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Nefree
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location next to public transportation with easy access to downtown and University of Washington. Nice accommodations and room for my family of 4. Service was poor. Took 3 calls to get a set of 4 towels the first day, then the maid only left 3 on the second day. Folks at the front desk we not helpful assisting with directions on getting around, giving wrong advice multiple times. Unhelpful arranging a taxi causing us to have to cancel dinner reservations. Room keys had to be rekeyed twice. Seemed uaware of Marriott Rewards program and perks. Almost refused to allow later checkout even though I am a Gold Elite Rewards member. I am a loyal Marriott business traveler and usually have a great experience but the service at this hotel was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and service but poor bed quality”
Reviews.Author: RunnerMom123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in a two bedroom suite. The customer service and breakfast were excellent. Overall, we enjoyed the stay. However, the one negative was the very poor bed quality. We were surprised since we always stay at Residence Inns and have had very consistent experiences for several years. However, the beds here were extremely mushy and sagged even when you just sat on them.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place”
Reviews.Author: liz7614
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn after a cross-country train trip. The facility is lovely, the rooms are clean and cozy, and the front desk staff are very helpful. The beds are SO comfortable. You can hop a trolley a few steps up the street that brings you into the downtown area. Pike Market is a 15 minute walk from there. I loved being able to prepare a light meal in the kitchen, and there is a Whole Foods Market a few stops away on the trolley. I would come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: KT182
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was great value for money and in a good location. All the rooms are suites with kitchen, fridge, sofa etc. Breakfast is included . It is self serve both hot and cold with an excellent choice. An added bonus is that it is very informal as you can sit anywhere throughtout reception in a pretty, informal environment. The Tram which runs into the Westlake Center is vitrually outside the Hotel. The staff were so helpful with advice, directions and maps. They helped us plan our night watching the Mariners and we found the underground to the stadium fast and easy to navigate. The Hotel is also within walking distance to The Space Needle and to pick up the Off/On Tour Bus. It is directly across the road from a marina with some lovely boats and some good restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “A Seattle Gem”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel66
Reviews.Content: Our pre-cruise stay at the Residence Inn was all we had hoped for & more. Great rooms in a high-rise type hotel overlooking Lake Union, just a short walk from downtown. Open balcony halls overlooking the lobby area. The staff was wonderful. The daily breakfast very fresh & tasty. The evening reception was wonderful. Management opened 2 large balcony suites with party size balconies for the wonderful 4th of July fireworks over Lake Union. If we ever travel back to Seattle, this wiil be our home away from home.We highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service, adequate food”
Reviews.Author: TravelTexan1
Reviews.Content: So, as many hotels, there were good and bad things with this hotel. I was in Seattle to visit friends that were in the Navy and to do a little business. While the Residence Inn was a little higher in price than I would like for it to have been, I thought it would be a nice trade-off since there is free breakfast,a few free dinner receptions, a full kitchen, a laundry room, and free Internet. So, I would stay here again, but have lower expectations as to food quality. So, the positives: (1) Good location- it is about an mile walk to the City center with the Space Needle and museums. Two to three minute walk to the trolley which will take you downtown for $2.50 and then walking distance easily down Pine to Pike Place Market. (2) The kitchen cuts down on costs- can bring leftivers back or pick up groceries. There is a Whole Foods on the trolley stop back to the hotel (Denny). (3) The wired Internet was quite speedy which helped for work (I brought an Etnernet cable but there was one hanging in the closet), (4) Good sized laundry room and you can get change at the front desk,and (5) Excellent service by the front desk employees. The two negatives: (1) The food was adequate. I was not expecting high quality, but this was by far the worst food I have had at a Residence Inn. If they have to cook it, it is not very good. Stay with muffins, toast or bagel, etc. The OJ was like orange colored water. and (2) The lake view I paid extra for was not much of a lake view- think partially obstructed view. Overall, I would stay here again, but would know that I would need to bring in more stuff to eat. The staff was extremely helpful and quick for the business services I used at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Plantravel
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. Is it the 19th best hotel in Seattle? I’m not sure as this was our first visit to Seattle. We had two rooms, one was booked through Marriott rewards points, and one was secured at an AARP rate. Our reward’s room was arranged in a typical Residence Inn layout (i.e. one bedroom with King Bed, and one living room with sofa bed. There was the usual kitchen area with a small eating table. The room was spotless, and the bed very comfortable. The second room had a lovely lake view and was one of the nicest rooms we have seen in any hotel. One huge room with beautiful furnishings, king bed, wood floors, love seat and chairs, with an open kitchen, and balcony. Truly a 1st class experience. Every staff member were very helpful, and the breakfast was a step up from the usual full Residence Inn breakfasts. Food was refreshed often, and nothing ran out, be it drinks, pastries, hot items, coffee or juices. Breakfast can be eating on a number of tables located in the open atrium, or in a more private area with free newspapers available. The hotel is located across the street from a number of good restaurants. We would recommend Duke’s Chowder House. Tip: Order off the daily specials menu for lunch and enjoy some “just caught seafood”. On our visit it was Halibut fish and chips. All in all we highly recommend this hotel, it is a 15 minute walk to the space needle, but a taxi is probably the easiest way to reach the Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Convenient to Downtown and Lake Union”
Reviews.Author: Red-Barchetta2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before our cruise. The hotel was overall very convenient. We had a 2 bedroom suite which had lots of room and full kitchen. We had a single bedroom suite but we were upgraded to a two bedroom corner unit facing Seattle Center. The only nit with the room was that some of the furniture in the living area was getting a little tired. They had a nice breakfast buffet with a good overall selection of food. We had a rental car for the day and park in their garage which costs about $21 a night. You can save money by parking on the side street around the property. Since we were going on a cruise we wanted to return the rental car. We returned the car at the Avis lot, than after some site seeing used the street car to return to the hotel which the last stop is within a couple hundred feet of hotel. The hotel does not have shuttle service to the cruise dock but they use a local car service. They receptionist took care of the car arrangement for us. The car service cost $20 for a Lincoln Towncar from hotel to Pier 91. We were worried that the towncar would not fit all our bags but we fit 4 people in the car with 1 large and 2 medium suitcases plus 2 carryon bags in the trunk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Sharon091
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 travelling from Australia. We have 3 children 15, 13 and 11 year old. We booked and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. One room had a king bed that was very comfortable and the 2nd bedroom had 2 double beds. There was a sitting room with a couch that had a double bed in it. The room also had a kitchen with a small table. This area was not very big but we were not bothered by this as we were out all day. The hotel has a complimentary buffet breakfast that was great a good variety. It also had an inside heated pool but we didn't get the chance to use it. The hotel also had a laundry which was good, as it saved us from trying to find a laundry mat. Our room was not facing the lake and we didn't have any views but it was quiet which is what really mattered to us. We also had a hire car which we had to pay for parking. We walked from this hotel to the Seattle Space Needle and then caught the Monorail downtown. There was also a tram/bus outside the hotel that took you downtown. Overall we liked this hotel and thought everything was quite accessible from here.

Reviews.Title: “I would give excellent had the room been ready at 4PM”
Reviews.Author: jeffbunten
Reviews.Content: Great location, right on the Street car line in Seattle and within walking distance to the Needle. Room not ready when we arrived at 3:45 PM and we were told would not be available until after 4:30 PM. Normally, not a problem but we had been traveling since 5AM (3AM PDT) and were weary. Check in is at 4PM. Arrived back at 5:30 and the room was ready. The room itself was excellent, breakfast buffet great, great lobby, quiet rooms. great view of the space needle/ streetcar line. Only other ding on this hotel is its parking. . The parking garage is extraordinarily tight. really difficult to park in. If I am paying to park, I expect a large enough space to allow me to easily manuver into the spot. I should not have to go through multiple turns and gyrations to get into a spot. Quite frankly they would be better off with Valet parking at this hotel due to the tight quarters that have to be manuvered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay; loved it”
Reviews.Author: Live_frm_AsiaPac
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week, with four children and two adults, in a harbor facing suite with two bedrooms and kitchen. The front desk service was great- I had packages sent to the hotel and they were prompt about calling to pick them up or dropping them by the room. I also used the hotel safe; desk service was good. The suite was awesome. Beds were very comfortable; well stocked with towels; the kitchen was well stocked with cutlery, plates, glasses and cooking pans. We cooked lunch and dinner there each night. Breakfast was great; buffet with many options- eggs, cereal, toast, waffles, sausage. Very good. The eating area is large and so we didn't have trouble finding a table for all of us. We used the laundry three times; the washers were good; the dryers sometimes took two cycles (all were $1 each go). We used the pool (indoor) and hot tub everyday; in good condition; a good size. We enjoyed it. There is a park in front of the hotel and the harbor has a nice walkway so we spent about an hour taking a walk around just close to the hotel. We rented a car for the week and parked on the street next to the hotel the entire stay. Hotel parking is $20/day and is a needless expense. You have to pay for parking on the street but it is very low and you can park for up to 10/hrs at a time. You have to pay for parking from 8AM to 6PM and is free all other times. It rocked. Overall this is one of my most happy stays at a hotel. I have been around the world in all sorts of 5 star places- and this place hit the sweet spot for me. In fact, my husband was booked in at the Silver Cloud Inn- Lake Union down the street, and he left his hotel one night early to hang out with us instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Seattle, Not a Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fumador
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at this hotel in the late 1990s and made reservations again because we remembered it to be a wonderful place in a good location. Well, either my standards have gone way up over time (which is very possible), my memory is more generous than this location deserves (definitely likely), or the place has just seen better days. There was nothing particularly "bad" about our stay, just nothing that knocked our socks off or convinced us that we should come back anytime soon. We stayed in a two bedroom suite with king sized beds and a fold out couch in the living room, so there was plenty of space for our group of four adults. Breakfast was good with an adequate selection of fruit, cereal, muffins, pastries, eggs, and sausage, but whoever's in charge of food service has committed a cardinal sin for any hotel in Seattle: the coffee was intolerably weak four days running, even the brew that was billed as the "dark blend." I must confess that, perhaps, my review is biased by the fact that there were SO MANY guests at the hotel with dogs in tow. I love dogs and have three back home, but it is a pet peeve of mine (no pun intended) when folks insist upon traveling with them and staying in hotels. Thank goodness, I suppose, that there are good hotels who accommodate travelers with dogs, but if this is a problem for you this is definitely not your place. I also agree with a previous review regarding this hotel's high ranking among Seattle hotels. It is quite definitely NOT the 14th best hotel in Seattle. This Residence Inn's location can't be beat, with easy access to the Seattle Center, the Pike Place Market, the University District, or pretty much anything one might wish to do in the area. For the price, though, one can stay in a much more luxurious hotel with some character.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful pet friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly A
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in a great location with a very pet friendly staff! The rooms are nice and the breakfast is great!

Reviews.Title: “A really nice place to stay near lots of Seattle fun”
Reviews.Author: rrgreennc
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Wednesday to Saturday early in June before a cruise trip departing from Seattle. My wife and I, our 15 year old daughter, and my wife's parents stayed in a 2-bedroom suite which was very comfortable. One room had a king bed and the other had 2 queens. Additionally the sofa bed was quite comfortable according to my daughter, who chose it over the queen bed in order to have her own space (and TV). Having 2 bathrooms was also a big asset for the 5 of us. The kitchenette was small but fine for us. We didn't do any cooking, just heated up leftovers, made coffee, and kept drinks in the fridge (icemaker was nice to have). The living room area was comfortable for all of us to sit around in the evening, with a comfortable chair and sofa, plus the 4 chairs in the kitchenette. We did not have a lake view or balcony but I didn't consider that a downside. We did have a rental car (a minivan), and did not really find the size of parking spaces to be a problem. I was able to drive to the back of the level for full size cars (there are 2 entrances and it appeared 2 different levels), and find plenty of spaces. I will admit that it is a bit of a challenge dealing with the concrete support pillars (which were really more of an issue than the width of the space), but it is possible to park a large vehicle here. I do feel that the cost for parking in their deck is high, but it was a secure lot, only accessible using the hotel keycard. We had barbeque food for the manager's reception (only Wednesday, since it is only done Mon-Wed), and the food was quite good, especially considering it was free. Breakfast was also very good, and we considered this one of the important factors in choosing this hotel). We rented a car to make getting around simpler, but the Seattle traffic (especially at rush hour), bizarre intersections (I counted 7 streets coming together at one place), layers of roads (which confused the GPS or at least my understanding of it!), and parking cost made this less than enjoyable. However, since 2 of our group can not walk very far at a time, we felt this was a better choice for us than using public transport. In a different situation, I would probably go with public transport (or even walk - Seattle Center and its attractions would be walkable). Laundry facilities at the hotel were quite nice and reasonably priced. The room was kept at a reasonable temperature and both washer (30 minutes) and dryer (60 minutes) were one dollar. We also enjoyed the hot tub (except for one night when it was closed due to an "accident" in the water :), and my daughter went into the pool, although it was a bit chilly for my taste. There is a nice pool with dept from 3-6 feet, and a smaller separate wading pool. The fitness center was also nicely equipped. One downside of this hotel was that there were no restaurants to speak of within a short distance (especially for walking). However, we were offered menus for a number of restaurants offering delivery. We discovered a very nice pizza at Pagliacci's, which had pepperoni from Salumi's. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful whenever called on. Everything was very clean. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. For a group like ours, the 2 bedroom suite was a great deal compared to 2 separate rooms at other hotels. The amenities made the room rate an even better option.

Reviews.Title: “"Lived" here for a month and it was great.”
Reviews.Author: Seattlekatieh
Reviews.Content: Due to a flood in my condo my insurance company put me up here for 3.5 weeks. The rooms are nice - exactly as they are in the photos. In fact I think most rooms are identical down to the decorations. Noise: I had a 1 bedroom on the backside of the building on the 6th floor. I looked out on office buildings, a play area for a daycare, I5, etc. Not super scenic but quiet, which was much more important to me than a good view. I didn't hear any of my neighbors the entire time and I know it was sold out at least two of the weekends I was there. Despite being above the atrium I never heard the breakfast crowd noise. Cleanliness: The place was spotless with clean sheets and towels. My room had a dishwasher and the houskeeping staff would run it if they saw I had used a number of things. Comfort: The couch was a weird chaise lounge type thing, but otherwise the funiture was great. The bed has a pillowtop which was a little soft for my taste (and I probably only noticed it because I was there for so long). The king bed is huge, so it was a lovely change from my bed at home. Exercise Facilities: The work out room is well equipped with towels, water, weights, machines, treadmills and eliplicals. I never had to wait to use anything. I did not use the sauna or the pool/hot tub but lots of people seemed to be enjoying them. Service: The staff were fine - not super friendly but also not in my business. When I needed more hangars they were brought up promptly. I thought after 3 weeks they might have started to recognize me coming and going. They didn't, but its no big deal. They were there when I needed them which is the important part. Location: It is within walking distance to downtown or an easy bus or streetcar ride. To get to other areas of the city you will want a car or taxi. I had to either walk about 1/4 of a mile to a bus to take an express bus (309) to work or take two buses (I work on First Hill at Harborview) to get there. The neighborhood feels safe. It is THE up and coming neighborhood of Seattle. There is a lot of money being spent on new offices and condos to house Microsoft/Gates Foundation/Amazon yuppies. Once the Mercer Street construction is done it will be way more walkable. If you are looking for a hotel on the lake this is not it--the lake is across a very busy street and behind many businesses. Unless you are renting a houseboat you will not find anyplace actually on the lake. Parking: Parking is very, very tight. I drive a 95 Honda Civic and I fit neatly and snuggly in the spots. They seem to have a seperate garage for SUVs but there were a number of larger cars parked in my garage too. The car got dinged/scratched on the door from someone parking too close/not paying attention. A lot of the cars were rentals so I don't think people were as careful opening doors as they are in their own cars. My car is not new and already has dings so it was not a huge deal but if you care about that you might be best on the street or in the SUV lot. Food: The breakfast buffet was great! Healthy and not healthy options everyday. I have stayed at a lot of hotels that offer "continental breakfast". This is a serious buffet breakfast. Mon-Wed there is a "managers reception" with food and (on Wednesdays) beer and wine. It varied from hot dogs and potato salad to a nice selectionof greek food to BBQ. Not super healthy, but free. And if you are exhausted and don't feel like cooking yourself dinner it is a great benefit. Internet: the wifi is free after you accept their terms (check a box). The wifi was fast and never went dow the entire time. TV: my room had a TV in both rooms with a nice picture and limited cable channels. Value: the rooms are not cheap and parking is $20/night. But if you need a clean, safe room with all the comforts of home it is worth it. I have absolutely no complaints about the Residence Inn. It was my home when I needed one and I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: Ashesval
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in early May and have a 1 year old and a 3 year old. We chose a 1 bdrm suite and it was perfect. We didn't really need to use the kitchenette much since there is the breakfast and 3 days of managers special dinner. The parking was indeed tight and we scraped the rental car (toyota camry). I can understand why it is $21 a night as we come from a larger city with high parking fees in the downtown area. Location was good and we enjoyed the streetcar and walking to downtown with the stroller. Enjoyed Dukes Chowderhouse and I Love Sushi across the street with the kids. Pool was clean, albeit a bit cold. Staff very friendly, and never too busy for you. Nice playground across the street. Would recommend this hotel to any friends travelling to Seattle with kids, and even without.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice-Free parking if you know where to look*”
Reviews.Author: Marius40
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, clean, spacious, lots of choices for breakfast. Some things I haven't seen in other reviews. Directly past the hotel less then 25 yards is Aloha Street on one side, Valley Street on the other side. Both of these streets border the hotel. Parking is FREE from 6 p.m. to 8 a.m. AND Parking from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. is $1.25 an hour with a TEN hour maximum. There are machines that take credit cards. So even if you were to park there for 24 hours it would still only be $12.50 compared to the 20+ they charge inside the hotel. Also directly across the street from the hotel are numerous seafood restaurants right on Lake Union. We ate at Joey's one night and C (something) the next night. Both were excellent. The hotel is less than five minutes to downtown and ten minutes by car to Pike's Market. Reasons the hotel didn't get five stars. Like most properties, their fitness facilities were only okay. Two Life Fitness ellipticals, two treadmills, and a few free weights. There is a very nice 24 Hour Fitness at 1827 Yale Street, approximately five minutes away by car. Their "evening food" was plentiful; however they only serve it Monday through Wednesday; what is up with that?? And they only offered beer and wine on Tuesday. Also, during rush hour from downtown this hotel takes a while to get to with a lot of traffic trying to get on I-5. Non-rush hour is a breeze. Staff is very friendly which is always a plus. Internet is free as it should be. Overall, an excellent place where I will stay again. Cheers. Marius

Reviews.Title: “Our Hotel of choice for Seattle now !!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCapt.
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for the 1st time in February for a night . We were getting together with friends from Eastern wa . We have stayed at many hotels in Seattle over the years and this will be the one from now on. Great Value for the price , huge room , We booked a 2 bedroom suite ,we had lots of room and large patio also a full kitchen. And is right across the street from great restaurant's !!

Reviews.Title: “How Can They Legally Charge For Parking!!!???”
Reviews.Author: familyvac5
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Rooms were great. Breakfast was best I have ever had at a hotel. Parking situation was a nightmare! Not sure how they can legally charge $26 to park in a garage where the spaces are too small and tight to actually park in. Turning radius was so small I had to go back and forth 12 times to get turned into it. Even the small cars were so close together that I'm sure everyone had door dings. Only way I would stay there again would be if I didn't have a car. Seemed a bit greedy to try and fit that many spaces in.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly the best hotel stay I've had in years!”
Reviews.Author: theforeigntraveller
Reviews.Content: After a weekend in Vegas my girlfriend and I needed a break, so we drove down from Vancouver to drop a friend off at Seatac and stayed the night here. Unexpectedly great. Super professional and really friendly front desk staff. Reception for us at 5:00 with a free stocked salad bar! Free breakfast with a serious selection ( eggs, bacon, muffins breads etc, waffles, juice and coffee ) Big, clean rooms with flat-screens in all 3. 4-5 good,popular restaurants across the street on the water/marina. Will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “After reading previous reviews, guess I expected a palace- still, it was very nice.”
Reviews.Author: auradain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a one bedroom suite Jan. 19-23. Though I asked for a higher floor in my reservation, my teenage daughter and I were given a room in the front of the hotel on the second floor. After our long trip to get there, we were just too tired to complain. The next day, however, when I walked outside onto the balcony, I felt like I was standing in the middle of traffic - the street outside, though on the banks of Lake Union, is very busy and loud. The reception staff was very cordial and friendly, and promptly moved us to the back of the building on the 5th floor for the rest of our stay after I stated my concerns. The one bedroom suite is somewhat smaller than what I expected, but still very convenient to have the pull out sofabed and kitchen - fully stocked. Besides a bit of a stain on the carpeting, cleanliness was not an issue. The king sized bed is luxurious. Since we arrived on a Wednesday, we were able to partake in the evening reception (Mon., Tues., Wed. only) which on that day included hotdogs and beans - and wine/beer - included in the room rate. The daily breakfast was really quite good : make-your-own waffles, scrambled eggs, sausage, etc. And there's always coffee, tea, and hot chocolate available in the lobby. The hotel is located at the end of the streetcar line from Westlake and Olive (South Lake Union Trolley) so even without a car, it is convenient to get to the downtown area ($2.50 adults, $.75 youth, senior, disabled). From SeaTac, we took the light rail to Westlake (very reasonably priced at around $4.50, adult) - a nice and convenient 35 minute ride. All in all, a nice stay at the Residence Inn - but it's not a palace :-D (PS This is a non smoking hotel, and curiously includes the outdoor balconies)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay and dog-friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Shampel99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two dogs, stayed here in order to attend the Seattle Boat Show. The hotel is directly across the street from the show docks. We were given a free upgrade to a two-bedroom, two bath suite--a pleasant surprise! The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. The beds were too soft for my taste, but then I like them rather hard. Nice decor, clean and comfortable, decent breakfast--overall, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great weekend staging area”
Reviews.Author: tabb7118
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the Marriott Residence Inn at Lake Union when we spend the weekend with another couple in Seattle. It has suites with separte bedrooms and bathrooms and is well maintained, easy parking, Sunday breakfast in the Courtyard. This hotel has been very well kept up over the years and is totally friendly to weekenders.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Residence Inn ever”
Reviews.Author: chaub
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty sure this property was a Ramada or something, because the layout is of a full-service hotel. They have a beautiful lobby and dining area with waterfalls. The inside is open and the hallways look out to the main foyer. Since it was slow in October, they upgraded me to a 2-bedroom unit with a space needle view, I didn't even ask! They were so kind and helpful during our entire stay. The local area is absolutely beautiful, but I wish there were a few more good restaurants nearby. Most of the ones close were overpriced and not all that great, but we had a full kitchen so that's not a problem! We took the train from the Seattle Airport to downtown. We then caught the seattle street car on the corner of west lake and olive (it's on the ground level, right in front of Bank of America in case you get lost), That took us almost directly to the Residence Inn (get off at Lake Union Park or the one right after it). Right across the street they have boat rentals and a lot of other water activities. You can rent kayaks up at the University of Washington if you have a car for pretty cheap. We hit up the Theo Chocolate Factory tour which a must (not even a chocolate guy, but they have the best stuff ever). You can technically walk from the hotel to downtown (we walked at around 7pm to the whole foods downtown and felt perfectly safe) but it's a bit of a trek. The food they serve for lunch and breakfast was really good, better than most residence inns. The pool area was well kept and huge compared to most in the city. They really have a top notch hotel here, and this is the best value you can get in the city. All in all, we loved our stay at the Residence Inn and can't wait to go back to Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel I have ever stayed in for a family with young children!”
Reviews.Author: SunnyMama81
Reviews.Content: From the time we made our reservation to the time we checked out, everything was perfect! One of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed in. The price was comparable for our two bedroom suite as a single room elsewhere. Plus they have a complimentary breakfast which with a family of four saved us a lot of money!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Jim49212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during an overnight trip to Seattle to celebrate our 27th anniversary. Location is perfect and the view of Lake Union is magnificant. The room was extremely clean and looked recently upgraded. My only complaint is the charge of $21.00 for parking. This hotel is also serviced by Light Rail Service to downtown Seattle, about a 7 minute ride. Major restaurants are located within walking distance from the hotel. This is a large hotel and I think could benefit from a lobby cocktail lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Did request an early check-in when I arrived. Girl behind the desk informed me that check-in was at 4pm, I ask if they might be able to accommodate me eariier, after a moment with a negative look about her she said yes. It would have been nicer when I asked her if she could accommodate me earlier, to have checked and then with a smile said yes, rather than the more negative "check in is at 4pm." I always think a positive approach by an employee is better than a negative one. Then she got busy on the phone and another girl checked me in, she was friendly and check in only took a few minutes. The lobby is huge and is very nice, there are two elevators and rooms are on seven floors. There is a small kitchen, with a small dinning area, a living room with a flat screen TV, large bedroom, with a flat screen TV, bath and shower. Plenty of room to stretch out. Free internet connection is also available. Breakfast which is included is very good. Hot foods, cold foods, plenty of choices and enough seating area, they use most of the large lobby to accommodate everyone. There is a bus stop outside of the hotel that will take one to downtown, or you can also go by streetcar. Walking will take about 20 minutes. One minus is that the property does allow dogs in the rooms, and there were a couple of times when I could hear them barking. Overall a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyLMP
