Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful place to stay and the staff unfailingly helpful. Hotel is not located downtown, but it is very easy to get there via the light rail that runs (quietly) in front of the hotel. Light rail runs often and late. We had a room with a lake view and we almost hated to leave it because it was so beautiful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a flagship property with top-flight people.”
Reviews.Author: WITravels1512
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in late July/early August. Front desk was professional, approachable and interested in making stay a good one. Floor staff, esp. cleaning people, were wonderful and interested in helping. Fitness equipment was in bad shape and no clue if anyone knew or cared about that. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service and accomodations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rollsy42
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel and the staff. I stayed at this hotel from 8/24/10-9/1/10 with one break for a night on Orcas island one night. Both times at check in our room was upgraded (no charge) to a higher level room, which was great because we had two 14 year old boys with us. The rooms, both times, were very clean and the beds were soooo comfortable, as you'd get in a 5 - star hotel. The bed just cradled me to sleep every night we were there. Now onto the breakfast buffet-this comes with the room and is wonderful. Each day there were items such as pancakes, sausage, scrambled edd beaters, make your own belgian waffles-a great thing for older kids to do themselves, and the usual cereal, oatmeals and some decadent pastries. we ate like kings and it was one less meal we had to pay for. The hotel has a trolley car that stops a few steps away that takes you into the downtown area for a minimal fee, and is just across from Lake Union, which is a great place to walk, and was being improved at the time of our stay with more walking areas, benches, lake-front viewing, etc. There are sea planes you can watch taking off and landing all day-very cool. Most of all, the people working the reception desk, especially Mary, were exceptional. They recommended restaurants and gave us great ideas for things to do with our boys, as well as treating us like family-honestly. We LOVED it here and hated to leave-would go back again in a heart beat-thanks to all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: zinnyVancouver
Reviews.Content: Oct 2009 was our 4th time staying at the Residence Inn Lake Union. The rooms are huge (2 bedroom and 2 bathroom units - perfect for families or groups travelling together), having kitchen/living room areas separate from the bedrooms is great, the kids can go to sleep while the adults visit. We always have a car when we're in Seattle, and find the hotel location great for getting to all parts of Seattle (although hotel parking is a bit pricey). What makes up for the parking fee is the complimentary breakfast - excellent selection of items, staff works hard to replenish everything. This is our first choice for our family of four when we visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great extended stay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pmlseattle
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Beautiful, clean rooms, great lake views, excellent service from all staff, convenient to downtown or Seattle Center. Fancy enough to make you feel pampered without being pretentious and stuffy. Just can't say enough how much we enjoyed our stay. The breakfasts are great too. The ADA rooms really are accessible for wheelchairs users, large bathrooms and staff are helpful with any accomodation requests. Just Excellent!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: higgins08
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent 6 days at the Residence Inn/Downtown Seattle/Lake Union. The Inn provides excellent service, rooms, and value. Our family of four adults and one infant shared our two-bedroom suite. This was perfect! The other two adults shared a one bedroom suite. Since we were part of a family reunion/wedding (24 people), from Arizona, Missouri, Indiana, Florida, and Texas we were able to meet for breakfast in the large atrium. The breakfast is wonderful -- not your typical "breakfast included." The breakfast buffet is comparable to a sit-down restaurant. We also met in the atrium every afternoon for coffee, visiting, and sightseeing plans. The desk is extremely helpful and the housekeeping staff is wonderful. The Inn is a perfect for families!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Eohippus
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the Residence Inn brand when we're traveling with our kids, and this one didn't disappoint. We took a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suite which provided the perfect break we all needed from each other about half-way through our 2-week-long trip. The kids each got their own queen-sized bed and their own bathroom, and we had our own bedroom with a king, separated from their room by a spacious living room and full kitchen. And our own private bathroom as well. Ahhhh.... The hotel has everything you need, especially when traveling with kids: a swimming pool and guest laundry being high on the list (only wish there were more washers/dryers -- 4 washers and 6 dryers were too few for a hotel of this size). The hot and cold breakfast buffet was more than expected, and the staff couldn't have been more helpful, especially in assisting us in planning a complicated route through the city using public transportation. Parking is available for $19/day and the garage (we used the upper garage for SUVs) opened right into the lobby, making the transfer of luggage a breeze. While the hotel is not right in the city center, there's a trolley just outside the front door which runs constantly and takes you right there. I didn't see much advantage to staying in a more expensive hotel with fewer amenities which might have been a hair closer to all the action. The only negative comment I can make regards the business center. I would swear the internet connection was dialup. Can that be possible? It was so slow I finally gave up trying to catch up on some email communications.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: threecharm
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel so we could see the fireworks on the fourth while we were in Seattle- without having to fight crowds and traffic. Upon arrival they were giving the kids little toys of a certain cartoon character- which is a seet gesture- and this cartoon character is very popular-but my little ones dont care for it and think it uses some less than polite humor-so they just declined nicely. Well the staff (Mary)thought it was so nice that my middle one would speak up and have some manners depsite the pressure to like these kinda things that they went out of their way to make up a little treat of cookies and juice- and one for his little sister. WOW for hotel staff to go out of their way for one guest with no expectation from the guest- I just can't say enough what an impression this left with us and my kids. Great location to see the fireworks- just walk out the door! There is also a park across the street and plenty of resturants that you can try without ever needing a car! Clean rooms- nice kitchen with everything you need for bringing in food- from Pikes Place or the nice QFS up the street! We slept in a few mornings- I mean really slept in! and housekeeping had our room ready and in perfect shape after we had finally gone out. I appreciate that kind of service- since I dislike making housekeeping wait and try to never do that-but once in awhile you just end up sleeping in and they were so accommodating. Nice lobby area- they have breakfast, but like I said we slept in so we missed it! Due to the perfect staff and great location we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pthang
Reviews.Content: Good chance to get room via Priceline . Each room is a suite with living room and bedroom with single king size bed . A lot of space with dishwasher, microwave, large home size refrigerator , deserve to be 5 stars. I love the morning buffet breakfast . It is the same as Embassy suites breakfast . Right out of hotel , I can take the street car ( electric bus ) to go downtown Westlake center ) for $2.50 one way . It is a frequent bus and very quiet and enjoyable air conditioning ride . Parking in Seattle is night mare and rip off for tourists , $10 per hour . Food at Pike market is over priced and dirty . I rather buy food at Westlake center at food court. It is clean , a lot of choices and price competitive . Also you can take monorail to Space Needle center from Westlake center top floor .

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay! Met & exceeded all our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: The_Concierge_8
Reviews.Content: We had thoroughly checked reviews before booking here and we were not disappointed. Being a smaller hotel and having such great ratings is really an accomplishment for this hotel! It was our first visit to Seattle and first time at a Residence Inn. We loved our stay!! We stayed for 3 nights, and then went to Vancouver for a few days and came back for another 6 nights. They kept our luggage for us while we were gone for 5 days which allowed us to pack light to Vancouver rather than lugging all the cases with us (other hotels we had called refused to keep luggage in storage for longer than 1 day). The location couldn’t have been more perfect! Streetcar line starts & ends across the road and you can catch one every 15 mins. Buses go by frequently too. Easy to get to downtown yet being abit out of the way from the noise & bustle. We got 2 different room-types and both had lovely terraces with lake views to enjoy the weather, a cup of coffee and watch the float planes take off & land on the lake. It was also convenient for us to take the Argosy Locks tour which leaves from Lake Union – a 7 minute walk to the dock from the hotel. The Center / Museum for Wooden boats is a 3-minute walk away which is worth the visit and around the corner are the old fire boats, tugs, Historic Steamship Virginia V and also the dock where you take the Ice cream boat (popular for families with kids) and the Queen of Seattle paddle boat. Lots to do & see in this area! Hot morning breakfast was enjoyable as well as the little market stand to grab a beer, snacks or soup at anytime day or night. Although the hotel has no restaurant to serve lunch or dinner, you do not miss this. There are loads of restaurants right across the road including great seafood at Duke’s Chowderhouse. The popular ‘I Love Sushi’ restaurant is also on the marina – just a 2-minute walk. There’s an Outback steakhouse just 1 set of traffic lights walk away as well. The best feature of this hotel for us was the laundry on the 3rd floor. Having packed light for our 2 weeks vacation between Seattle & Vancouver, it was wonderful to be able to wash our clothes and have a continuous supply of freshly laundered clothing for the entire time (while saving the extra space in our luggage for shopping/souvenirs). They have 4 washing machines, 6 dryers (coin-operated) and Soap, bleach & dryer sheets available for 50 cents with wash or dry loads costing just $1. Gym & indoor pool on the same level. Our rooms were cosy & comfy – felt like being at home, including full kitchens with proper full-size fridge & stove so we were able to stock up on supplies and you could cook if you wanted to as all crockery is provided. The staff made our trip just great! Megan, Rose, Taviya and others were always helpful and a delight to deal with - always a return welcome and a smile! If we were to go back to Seattle again, Residence Inn would definitely be our hotel of choice. I think few others could compare!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations- 1st time Seattle visitor”
Reviews.Author: makua
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Residence Inn at Lake Union while taking my son to see a graduate school opportunity. The front desk service was excellent, we decided to rely on public transportation this trip and they were very helpful. Transportation- a streetcar that goes to the heart of downtown (and within 4 blocks from Pike Place Market) is right across the street. Also, bus route 70 has a stop right across the street. Another benefit we found was that the hotel had "town car" service during the day and early evening, at pre-defined flat rates. For example, the cost to Safeco Field was $15, to the airport was $35. Breakfast - the breakfast each morning had a wide variety and everything was very fresh. Service - Megan and others were top notch and really cared about their guests. We will return again if in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights with my 10 year old grandson in May/June. We were visiting my son who is over in Boeing for a few months. We had the Two bedroom/ two bathroom suite. It was fabulous. 2 large bedrooms, massive amounts of storage. Each bedroom had its own bathroom and its own TV. I agree with another review about the beds though. I felt like I would roll off if I was near the side. Spotless rooms, especially bathrooms. Great suite with huge terrace and lovely terrace furniture with a view of Space Needle and Lake Union. Pity the weather was not great, did not get to use terrace at all. Great breakfast, eggs, potato cubes, sausages or burgers, scones, muffins, fruit, yogurts, granola, bagels, toast, pancakes, and a waffle maker to make your own waffles. Grandson had great fun with this. Breakfast finishes very early Monday to Friday 9am and 10am on weekends. We missed breakfast one morning and there is nowhere very local for breakfast. There are a couple of restaurants across from hotel but none for breakfast. Had to get streetcar into city centre. Pool and Jacuzzi were good. Pity there is no restaurant. They could certainly fit one in. Lobby area/Foyer is huge. Free coffee in lobby was great. My grandson loved the basket of free cookies on reception desk in the evening. Free WiFi was great. No problem connecting and could connect any amount of laptops at same time. Not very fast but enough for browsing. Parking is 19usd but only if you stay overnight. My son was visiting during the day so he was not charged. Great for people visiting family. 8 minute walk to Kenmore Air for seaplane trip which was great. We moved to Hyatt at Olive 8 for 3 nights which we did not like as much as Residence Inn Lake Union, we were sorry we moved, but wanted to do some serious shopping before we went home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: bdyl2133
Reviews.Content: Was here for four nights in May with my sisters. We had a two-bedroom/two-bath suite. Even though we didn't pay more for a full view of the lake, we were on the top floor and could still see the lake from where we were at. Our housekeeper did a great job. Very clean. The complimentary breakfasts are AMAZING. It included hot food as well as a waffle-making station and the usual bagels/danish/donuts/etc. Used the pool and hot tub, which were fine. The hot tub wasn't very hot the first night we were there, but it did seem to get better the next couple nights. The queen beds were nice and soft. I wasn't in the king bed, but heard it was a little harder. Each bedroom plus the living room had a TV. As for location, there's a streetcar stop right across the street that takes you into downtown Seattle. We didn't rent a car, and used the streetcar every day. Pikes Place Market and the Wastington State Ferries are within walking distance from the final streetcar stop. (If you don't mind walking. It was a great way to see downtown Seattle.) The streetcar also has a stop right outside of a Whole Foods. We walked from the hotel to the Space Needle. Probably about a mile, and not a pretty view during the walk, but not too bad. There was a bus stop about a half-mile away that took us to the Fremont neighborhood. The staff was very helpful when we asked for directions on how to get somewhere. The room itself was a lot nicer and bigger than I expected, and I was very impressed. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, more than expected”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye56
Reviews.Content: This is a very attractive hotel with a full open atrium lobby complete with tables and chairs for sitting, large waterfall and great ambiance. The 2 bedroom suite was all we expected and more. The king beds were comfortable. Each bedroom had it's own flat screen TV, full bath, and walk-in closet. We were right on Fairview Ave and had virtually no street noise. The pull-out was as comfortable as a pull-out gets. The TV stand in the sitting area was actually a storage unit for clothes, so we each had our own chest of drawers. The morning breakfast rivaled a restaurant for selection, sausage, scrambled eggs, toast, hash browns, cereals, waffles, fresh fruit, and on and on. Anytime we called the front desk for something, the phone wasn't cold before someone was at the door with our request. The only downside to this hotel was that there was an additional $19 charge for on-site security parking, but I soon found out during our stay that parking in Seattle anywhere is more precious and about as expensive as gold. The location just off I-5, close to Seattle Centre and downtown, overlooking Lake Union is very good. Restaurants are within walking distance. Great wireless and wired internet.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantstic staff and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercs1096
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a Princess Cruise to Alaska and stayed at the Residence Inn Pre-Cruise and loved the staff and hotel, we stayed again post cruise. We had a two bedroom two bathroom suite my wife and I shared with her two sisters. The rooms were seperated by a Kitchen and living room area. The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was exceptional. We had never been to Seattle before and Mary, Susanne and Eric were always there to help us with our sightseeing questions and needs. The fist day we walked to the space needle and then took the monorail to downtown Seattle and Pike's Market. We then took the streetcar back to the hotel. We had a reservation at another hotel post cruise, but cancelled it and went back to the Residence Inn. They have a great breakfast in the morning, free Wi-fi in the rooms, and it is right out the door from Lake Union, great restaurants and the marina. The hotel rates were reasonable and we just can't say enough about the city, hotel and the staff. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmegg3
Reviews.Content: I just spent a couple days at the Residence Inn/Lake Union with my husband and two sons, 22 and 27. We had a two bedroom suite (one king bedroom and the other bedroom had two double beds) which was so nice because we could all still have our privacy as well as being able to hang out together in the spacious family room/kitchen area. The beds were so comfortable and the rooms are very attractive and clean. Also, the price is a good value for a family. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mguerard
Reviews.Content: This Residence Inn is an all-suites facility. Since we were traveling with my married daughter and her husband, as well as our other adult daughter, the suites made the trip totally enjoyable. We had room to spread out, televisions in all rooms, a full kitchen. And the Residence Inn breakfast buffet is the best I've seen anywhere. The downside was the bed felt as if it had been used quite a while -- you tended to slip off to the sides where the imprints were. It's right on a trolly line so travel to downtown Seattle locations is easy, and the view of Lake Union is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight getaway”
Reviews.Author: df_genre
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a quick overnight getaway in town with our 2 1/2 year old daughter. We were very pleased with our stay at the Residence Inn. The staff was very accommodating, and in addition to making a dinner reservation for us at nearby Daniel's, hooked us up with a complimentary appetizer at the restaurant! The room was very clean and had tasteful decor (and a very comfortable bed!). The bathroom was pretty standard (what you would expect). The room was pretty quiet for the most part, though there were some loud motorcycles and sirens around 10:00 p.m. -- it got quiet after that though. Great balcony view! Also enjoyed the pool (and especially the 3 ft. deep kiddie pool, which was perfect for our daughter). The free breakfast was a nice touch too! (Get there early though -- it does get a bit crowded at the buffet.)

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: OutofAK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more than we expected! The room had a full kitchen, not just a mini fridge & microwave like some. They even have a gas grill on the patio that can be used by guests. The continental breakfast was the best I've ever seen, with all kinds of selection for both hot and cold food. The rooms were updated and clean. The only thing one might complain about was the CFL light in the bathroom took quite awhile to get bright enough to see. Our balcony had chairs to enjoy the sunshine and Lake Union was just across the street. Our room was nice and quite too. We didn't use the pool or exercise room, but both looked well kept. The parking garage is also secured and well lit, which was great. We got an amazing deal with "Name Your Own Price" on Priceline. We wished we would have realized that there was a stovetop and full refrigerator for cooking, or we would have gone by a grocery store before getting to the hotel. There is no convenience or grocery store in the immediate (easy walking) area. Across the street is the Center for Wooden Boats and there will soon be a large park to enjoy. The street car and bus stops are located on the same block as the hotel and go directly into downtown. Only a couple blocks up Valley/Roy is Bucca di Beppo Italian restaurant which has amazing food. We try and go each time we are in Seattle (reservations are highly recommended!). And while not the most scenic walk (you have to walk along a very busy highway)it is within a reasonable walk of the Seattle Center (Space Needle). The Experience Music Project at Seattle Center is also a must see & the Duck Tour is well worth it! We highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay here again the next time we come to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful on the outside, Dirty on the inside”
Reviews.Author: country_livin
Reviews.Content: We paid over 200 dollars for one night here in Marriotts Lake Union Washington. The carpets were filthy, the bathroom floors were filthy and the Pool area was filthy. Our hopes were dashed when we went to the pool and whirlpool in the evening to relax and it was flooded with water. The pool was cold and the whirlpool was closed off for repair. I was so disappointed in my stay, I will be very careful booking with Marriott in the future. There were 2 good things: the pillow soft bed and a wonderful breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Could use a make over.”
Reviews.Author: LVagabond
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful, but the hotel itself is outdated and in need of repair. We found one of the toilets in our room running, and the bathroom sink was clogged. The view of Lake Union and the Space Needle from the room's huge balcony was lovely, but the screen door was stuck most of the time. The beds were plush and comfortable. Parking was a very, very tight squeeze, but it was nice that it was in a gated area. The free breakfast was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Utahans
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay and were very pleased with the customer service. The guest reception (Mon-Wed) were fantastic for our family. Great items that could substitute for a light dinner. Breakfast was also great for our family although my husband was a bit tired of the same menu by the 3rd day. Distance to the Seattle Center were very nearby, especially helpful if you are taking one of the ferries. Staff and front reception were very accommodating and thoughtful. They noticed we were checking in with our younger children and were able to find us a room very near the pool. Now that's hospitality! A note to pet owners - they allow pets! We would definitely stay here again! Just a note: parking is $19/day and pretty standard along Seattle Center. You have to pay for parking everywhere you go. Pool area is rather tight with an awkward lay out and very little seating. Whirlpool was being renovated and not working while we were there. They also had a sauna and small kiddie pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast this side of the Rockies”
Reviews.Author: vthokie91
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. Very clean, well appointed and spacious. The public areas were huge with a large water feature. Check in was very quick and efficient. When we checked in for a weekend stay we had to sign a policy about not jamming too many people in the room and noise. The weekend during Spring Break did seem over run with lots of families. I was woken up once with kids running through the hallway late at night. The breakfast was fab. Some added touches made all the difference. You'll have to go and see for yourself. It is a little far off the beaten path, the noise from the roadway in room 302 was really more than I can handle and it seemed odd, I think the quality of construction of this hotel would mask most of that noise. On Friday night the traffic wouldn't stop. Request a non-lake/road view if noise bothers you. We took a taxi back from one outing and the taxi driver said the best food in Seattle is around that hotel. I didn't check it out with small kids, but maybe during your trip you can. The indoor pool was great for kids on vacation. The trolley/streetcar was a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value apartments, good location although not in the thick of things”
Reviews.Author: CairnsAussie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly with the hotel on line and from the booking process, through to our stay and check out this hotel was terrific. If you want downtown Seattle this is not for you, however dont discount it because of that reason. It is an easy tram ride into town, there are plenty of restaurants surrounding it from the cheap and cheerful Hooters to the upmarket Dan's broiler right across the road. The apartments were self contained, we were in a 1 bedroom which we prefer seeing we have a 10 month old baby. If had loads of room, everything was modern and clean and they leant us a hire chair for the duration of our stay. The kitchen facilities are a real bonus when you need to sterilise bottles and heat up food for a little one. The staff were very helpful and the hotel has a town car service which at a fee can take you to wherever you need to go. I used them a few times as I was travelling on business and it come in handy to go and get some wine and beer which wasnt within walking distance. They waited for me to come back and stood out the front to make sure I was ok when I was in there. The hotel does a breakfast of which I couldnt comment on as we just didnt get time to try it out. They also have laundry facilites which were great and not expensive compared to Australia. They have a gym and indoor heated pool also - we didnt use them but looked to be very nice and adequate. I would thoroughly recommend this property, especially if you are needing a bit of space. Dont discount the fact they arent in the middle of downtown Seattle, it is easy to get around, the people of Seattle we found so friendly and helpful, there are loads of eating options and it is very clean and comfortable. You have the tram and towncar service also which really helps in getting you wherever you need to be. Great hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Twinparks
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel while visiting family in the area. Newly remodeled rooms and lobby area were great. Desk service was very good. Didn't use the parking. Great deal on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for downtown location”
Reviews.Author: goblue05
Reviews.Content: We planned to arrive early, so I called to request early checkin. Nothing was available at the moment, but they took our number and called as soon as a room opened up (less than 1 hour). Arrived at front desk to find we had been upgraded to 2BR suite (reservation was for a 1BR suite)! All right! Room was a nice size, full size fridge. Crib was not the usual packnplay variety, but a solid one that sat higher off the floor and had a nice ftited sheet. Also provided a small blanket that was soft! (Previous hotel experience is worn packnplay with flat sheet tucked in, and a scratchy blanket). Since we had flown to Seattle, it was nice not to lug our own portable crib. Parking onsite is $19 day, but very convenient. Although we didn't use it, I noticed a streetcar stop right outside the main entrance of the hotel, and it headed into downtown. Marina and restaurants right across the street, along with a small playground set - great for kids to use up some energy! Whole Food Market about 1 mile away was great for premade food as well as regular groceries. Pool was nice, and complimentary breakfast was huge- eggs, waffles, pancakes, bagels, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, etc. etc. One note- I booked on their website, and the price had dropped when I checked back later in the week. I called them and they made the adjustment without a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Treated us like they couldn't wait for us to leave!”
Reviews.Author: jas1107
Reviews.Content: My family, including my 63 year old parents, sister, and 4 year old nephew, booked a room at this hotel on their way home from Hawaii to Juneau, AK. They have stayed here before and enjoyed their experience. This time, they arrived at the hotel (after 11pm due to a late flight) to discover their room had been given away, due to an emergency in which the hotel was putting up a family who's home had a fire. The hotel had made no effort to call my parents to notify them, though it is fairly obvious that they knew early in that day that the family would not be vacating the room my parents were suppose to have. The staff were not as apologetic as I would have expected, under the circumstances. They did find my parents a room at one of their other hotels. The room was a downgrade from the suite they had reserved. The hotel compensated them one night's stay but they had to pay for the other 2 nights in the small room, and the price ended up being only 10$ cheaper than the suite they had reserved. Although the staff called a taxi to transfer to the second hotel, there was no effort made to help my family with their bags (my Father is disabled). Once at the second hotel, the staff there acted as if they had no idea who we were, again did not offer any help with bags, and again, did not apologize for the huge inconvenience that this ordeal had caused. The staff's behavior was unacceptable and I would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms, great service, great location, all you could wish for, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: kiera1999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week when we arrived in the US from England before we were able to move into our house. Had two huge bedrooms for us and our two little boys (aged 6 & 3). With the kitchenette, living area and TVs in every room showing HBO movies we had all we could wish for. Staff very friendly and helpful. Delicious, varied and plentiful complimentary breakfasts and some evenings they provided complimentary light meals ("socials"). Pool. Streetcar outside hotel takes you to downtown Seattle within minutes. Lovely location by Lake Union. Beds very comfortable, I wanted to take mine home with me! No complaints, we had a wonderful comfortable stay, it was just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “surpassed our expectations”
Reviews.Author: BCBurks
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and our expectations were high but our experience was even better. Lovely building, beautiful atrium. Good location, a short, interesting streetcar ride from downtown Seattle. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Somebody must do a great job of training and managing staff. We really appreciated the free upgrade to a beautiful large suite with a view. Breakfast was great. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: gogogalcal
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this hotel to families. It's updated, clean and the service and amenities were terrific. We had everything we needed for a very fun 6 night stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but they allow animals, so watch out if you have alergies.”
Reviews.Author: funeraldir
Reviews.Content: It appears this is an older hotel, our room had much wear and tear, but all in all it was ok. Tended to heat up or cool down way to much. Breakfast was fantastic. Staff was nice. But we had no idea they allowed animals, my wife is allergic to dogs and it made her stay unpleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Truely a Gem”
Reviews.Author: MacandNisie
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this hotel in Seattle and will definately not be our last. The check- in was fast and the front desk very helpful. All the rooms have been remodeled and have very nice decor. They are two room suites with a door between the living area and the bedroom. We loved the open atrium with the water fall. Coffee, tea and hot cocoa are available 24 hrs a day in the lobby. The breakfast was more than continental. Eggs, sausage, pancakes, waffles, yougurt, toast , donuts, bagels,,,,I could go on and on. The location is only a mile and a half from downtown, very easy drive, and it is right off the I-5. We have stayed in and around Seattle and I think we found our permenant home. We paid $99.00 a night and parking was $20.00 a night. The pool and hot tub are adult only from 9-11 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a Seattle stay!”
Reviews.Author: chrissyberry
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by this hotel the moment I stepped into the lobby. The main lobby has a very open courtyard with a small waterfall. The guest rooms are spacious and comfortable and are decorated in warm reds and golds. I had a nice view of Lake Union from my third floor room. Parking is a secure underground garage (key access only), and costs $19.00 per day. The free breakfast was well-stocked, fresh, and had some items that I've never seen in other hotel breakfasts (Silk soymilk was available!). The fitness center was fairly large, with free weights, treadmills, elliptical machines, a bike and other equipment). The fitness center overlooked the pool (which looked nice, but I'm not a swimmer.) All this combined with a great location (very easy and quick access to downtown and the U. of Washington, and only ~15 min from the airport) make this a top choice for me.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: floralbrigades
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing. i cannot get over how incredible the staff were, i had so many questions and they managed to answer all of them. they were all really friendly too! the rooms were large, and clean, the bed was so comfortable and it was so nice to be able to cook for myself! the location was great, streetcar and buses at the doorstep! it was such a great hotel, it was the newest hotel i stayed at on my trip, and i was a bit sad because it lacked character, but the staff made up for it! did i mention how great the staff were?

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation with older kids”
Reviews.Author: PurpleLady1950
Reviews.Content: We went on a vacation to Seattle with our 21 and 22 year old kids. It was the ideal place to go. Our son is very into music and the Jazz scene in Seattle was fantastic. Our lunch in the restaurant at the top of the Space Needle was one of the highlights of our trip. The underground tour was educational. We stayed at the Residence Inn right on the lake. We has a 2 bedroom suite which worked out fantastic. Breakfast each day was included and the front desk went beyond the norm to make sure our trip was enjoyable. Pike Place Market had something for everyone and was a great place for people watching. If you have older kids, I highly recommend Seattle as a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: smokie7
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice and spacious. They were renovated last year. They were very quiet. The staff was excellent. They recommended places to eat, bus lines and any other issues that we needed addressed. They made us feel very comfortable. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way.”
Reviews.Author: spencil
Reviews.Content: With my mother and sister, we stayed 5 nights in a 2-bedroom, 2 bath (with kitchen & central living room room) suite at this lakeside Marriott Residence Inn, for a reasonable price. (Attached-garage parking is $19 per night extra, but friends of guests can park their cars free.) The room was clean and lovely, with a balcony and lots of light, as well as three flatscreen HG tvs and free wireless internet (or wired, if one prefers). The service was excellent. We asked for extra blankets and got nice comforters instead. The people at the desk were friendly and gave us good directions. And pets are evidently allowed, judging from the cute dogs we saw in the lobby! This is a great hotel for families and groups. A complete (and delicious!) free breakfast is served every morning in the lobby, a cheery, open, multi-level space with lots of tables and chairs. Although there is no real restaurant on the premises, there are 7 of them across the street. There is a pool/hot tub and decent-sized workout room on the third floor. At home we often stay at hotels during soccer tournaments, and I found myself thinking what a perfect place this would be for such an event, with a central gathering place available at all hours. The lobby is atrium-style, with surprisingly quiet acoustics. We decided to stay at this Residence Inn instead of a more centrally located downtown hotel because it didn't really matter to us where we were in Seattle. (On a prior trip, we had stayed nearby at the Pan Pacific, a cooler hotel with a Starbucks in it. But the PP valet service returned our just-rented car with a big scratch on it, and we spent the next year fighting with the hotel's insurance company for coverage.) I recommend this hotel very highly, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: ecp88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights with my husband on our first visit to Seattle. Very nice hotel, helpful staff, decent breakfast (I passed on the hot food, but it was great to be able to grab a muffin/fruit/yogurt before heading out each day). Location was great for us, however, we don't mind taking public transportation or doing a little walking. The streetcar and bus pick up right outside and will take you most anywhere you need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcoltrain
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location regardless of what people will say. Great restaurant across the street - Chandlers. Ask for outdoor seating especially when its nice and sunny out! Hotel staff was awesome, no complaints. Would highly recommend this place to everyone. However, it is a hike to downtown area, but use the streetcar and it will take to to downtown for like $2 for 2 hours. Also great breakfast joint nearby with streetcar. Can't remember the name but hotel recommended it. Rooms were spacious, decor was okay, not much of a view from balcony. If you need to stay in Seattle, stay here!! Only complaint is the price you pay for parking. Its absurd for parking your car there. But sometimes you can't help it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully clean, bright, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: aufinch
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night following our Alaskan cruise. We arrived at the front desk at 9:30am and though too early to check in, they locked up our luggage for the day and called later when a room became available. Upon returning to the hotel, we learned we were upgraded from 1 bdrm King lakeview to a 2 bdrm King lakeview. The whole family loved the suite arrangement with 3 TVs, nice views of Lake Union, a small balcony, effiecient kitchen, and two bathrooms. Very clean, quiet, and well kept. Only 1 mile from Seattle Center, we walked there, safe enough as a group. We used Shuttle Express to get to the airport the next morning, though the hotel recommended Lincoln Town Car service (which we did use in the past). Both services are courteous and economical. Hope to see Seattle again and will certainly check out availability on this high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: TrickyPicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this Residence Inn as a 'wind down' to our 2 week Alaska trip before heading home to Florida. While the rate seemed a bit pricey at over $300/night, what we got for that was 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, a full kitchen and sleeper sofa. When comparing single rooms and other suites in the area, this was the best deal around. It was also one of the nicest suites/rooms we've ever stayed in. Beautifully decorated, plush, comfortable bedding (king in one room, doubles in the other), sleeper sofa, internet, 3 tv's, etc. Service was very friendly and the included breakfast was superb, with just about everything you could want. Only downside was $19/day parking fee. Definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bubugala
Reviews.Content: We were there last week, stayed 3 nights. We booked a 1 bedroom without lakeview and was upgraded to a 2 bedrooms without lakeview. Kids were very happy as they got a queen size bed each and TV in their room. The kitchen corner was excellent (have microwave, dish washer and a huge fridge), especially the first 2 days of our stay. Kids and I were sufferred from jet lag and therefore we just ordered dinner and eat at the kitchen corner. The 2 bedrooms suite also comes with two separate bathroom & WC, clothsets. Kids love the swimming pool : an activity they look forward while came back from a long walking day in downtown. Oh yes, and free Wi-Fi service which my husband cheered for it. Breakfast was good, lots of selection: u can make your own waffel, self-refillable coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ICYGIRL64
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend, we were upgraded from a 1 bedroom lakeview to a 2 bedroom lakeview. We were traveling with our 2 girls (13 and 10). Our friends also stayed there with their 2 girls (11 and 9), and they were upgraded to a 1 bedrroom lakeview room. Rooms were clean, well appointed with comfortable furniture and beds. The staff were friendly and attentive to any needs we had. They even have barbeques outside and available to use if you want. There were many public transportation options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good family setup”
Reviews.Author: hey_javacat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about a week in May, 2009. We were 3 adults and a 2 year old and had a two bedroom suite. Everything about the hotel was as expected; comfortable and clean, a small usable kitchen, a small common living area, free internet, TVs, 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. The suite was spacious enough and perfect for our family travelling together. The breakfasts were excellent and included many hot and cold items. The staff was very helpful, and the location was great; near Lake Union and with easy access to downtown via a walk or the tram. Our only complaint was that the beds were much too soft. All the beds in the suite were the same. They were uncomfortable for all, and we are not picky about these things. We didn't try to change rooms and we didn't test other suites, so can't say whether that issue goes beyond our room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: queensgirl76
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one week (June 27-July 4). The hotel is very clean and modern and staff were friendly. The breakfast was good, but get there early because it gets crowded. On July 4th, the lobby was decorated with American flags, etc. They were also giving out pinwheels to children. I thought this was a very nice touch. The location is good if you want to go to Seatlle Center or downtown. To see the rest of Seattle (west Seattle, Ballard, etc.), you need a car. The parking fee at this hotel is $19/day plus tax. I thought this was a bit steep but you had to pay for street parking outside the hotel and it seems like you have to pay to park everywhere in downtown Seattle. Also, the wireless internet is included in the room price and there is a business center open 24 hrs that is also free. Overall, I loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Pre-cruise Option for Group of 4!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sproketz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before our Alaska cruise. I chose it because we had 4 adults and this hotel had a separate bedroom. (It also had a kitchen, but that wasn't important to us.) It exceeded our every expectation! The rooms were georgeous -- beautifully decorated in trendy, contemporary themes, king bed, 2 large flat panel TVs, granite countertops, etc. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was better than any continental breakfast I've had. It was a bit away from the usual tourist attractions, but a quick taxi ride. The street car line is also close by.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific choice for us”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: Marriott's Residence Inns seldom disappoint. This hotel was in a nice location away from downtown but with public transportation that takes you straightaway there. It is across the street from the lake with a multitude of restaurants. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom because we had two dogs - how considerate and accommodating! Service was great, free hot breakfast was great, our room with full kitchen was great, the surroundings were great, the price was great. We stayed at the Residence Inn in Portland last summer and found all the same wonderful qualities: GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! and not out of the way!”
Reviews.Author: cosmo27410
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our first trip to Seattle. We have stayed at other Residence Inns around the east coast and this one did not disappoint. As a matter of fact it was better than we expected! Everyone at the front desk was super friendly and the hotel was very clean. It was located out of the main downtown area but close enough to get there. It only took us about 5 minutes to get to the main waterfront by car. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable (which is important to us). Another important fact was it was super quiet. No noise from the outside (traffic) or from the inside (hallway or other rooms). The bathroom was very clean and well laid out. The breakfast buffet was nice, which was pretty basic for a Residence Inn. We did not partake in the managers reception on Wednesday, but it looked nice. The only negative comment is you have to pay for parking (which you have to anywhere in Seattle), but the parking is under the hotel, which I assume would be owned by the hotel. The parking was $19 a day, plus a $3 tax on top of that (which we did not know about). There are several restaurants around the hotel, which were pretty pricey. There is an Outback down the street and a Buca di Beppo next to it (so good!). All I can say is when I go back to Seattle I will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: switch2planb
Reviews.Content: While not a luxury hotel, it was VERY, very nice. Comfortable, clean, roomy. Beautiful indoor atrium layout. Right on Lake Union, just a short train or taxi ride to Pikes Market and downtown. Several great restaraunts right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful and the beds-SO COMPFY-close to UW”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelwithkidz
Reviews.Content: Our extreemly long day started off with a 6:00am flight, then toured 2 colleges with our teens. When we arrived, our rooms were not ready and our teens were asleep on the lobby couches. The managers quickley upgraded our room when they saw the kids. The room as so wonderful!!! Two bedrooms, two full baths and a full kitchen. Our view was fantastic (right on the lake) and we had a huge patio that wrapped around . The beds were so comfy and the place was so clean. The breakfast was nice and hot and the cookies in the afternoon were great too! The staff was so helpful with directions and places to eat . Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Gets More Than 3 Stars in My Book”
Reviews.Author: shelbymom
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the place is that the rooms really are "suites", which to me means that there's a bedroom where you can close the door and a separate living room area. That these rooms also have a kitchen is icing on the cake. Fresh, bright furniture. Our room didn't have a water view (probably because we booked through Priceline). At the end of one day I really enjoyed returning to the room, putting on my jammies, popping some popcorn, grabbing a beer from the frig and watching a movie. Wonderful selection at breakfast and plenty of tables to sit at and eat in the lovely atrium. Across the street are several restaurants to choose from - A couple of more expensive places like Joey's and Daniels Broiler, but also a Hooter's and, a little further down the street, an Outback. One day I walked to the Pike Place Public Market. It's about 1.5 miles away and there wasn't much to look at or enjoy along the way. Parking is $19 plus tax and you don't have to deal with a valet. Housekeepers were particularly nice. Their names were Hang and Belma and they were always smiling, saying hello, and made our room spotless every day. One even wrote a thank you note for the daily tip we left. There's an area in the lobby where you can buy soup, frozen entrees, cereal, beverages, etc. or they'll do the grocery shopping for you if you give them a list(for a fee, I'm sure). The only thing missing was the fireplace that we've enjoyed at many of the other Residence Inns, but I'd rather have the separate bedroom any day! Really glad we found a good place to land on our frequent trips to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Practical”
Reviews.Author: NewtonLondon
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn was a good place to stay as we were able to continue our half-marathon training - the Lake Union circuit being a good route near a city centre. Suite room was large although bathroom small, given that half of the large lounge felt unfurnished. Decor was uninspiring. Free breakfast buffet is hardly gourmet but good enough to start the day. Really, it fits the spec - space and facilities for longer stays at economical price. Access to centre very easy via modern quiet tram service. Reception staff always friendly and keen to give advice. Lots of restaurant choice nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I was in Seattle for business at UW and chose this hotel for a couple of reasons: 1) I am a loyal Marriott Rewards member, 2) It's location between UW and downtown Seattle, 3) the solid reviews from other TA members. I was not let down at all. At check-in, my elite status was recognized and I was upgraded to a luxury suite with a wrap-around balcony (larger than the balcony at my home). The room was recently renovated and had a nice flat-screen television on a swivel plate so you could view it from bed or the living area. Residence Inn probably has the top free breakfast across all hotel chains and this was no different. Great location. A block from the Seattle Streetcar which runs right downtown to Pacific Place (and from there it's a 5 minute walk to Pike's Place). Just across the street are a number of what looked to be quality restaurants. However, I took advantage of the 30 for 30 restaurant promotion that runs through the end of November and would recommend doing the same if you are there before the end of the month. The promotion is called Dine Around Seattle and it allows you to get a fixed price 3 course meal for $30 at any of 30 top restaurants. All-in-all, a hotel I will be returning to next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Maximum comfort & flexibility near downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: I have to confess my arrival at the Residence Inn on Lake Union was not an auspicious beginning. I arrived on a Saturday at 3 PM after 11 hours of travel, and the desk clerk cheerfully informed me the room wasn't ready. Check-in is at 4 PM (astoundingly late, I thought). She suggested I kill some time enjoying the sights (and traffic?) of downtown Seattle while I waited. I've seen Seattle. No thanks. I was tired and irritable. I opted to simmer with my frustration in the "TV Lounge" just off the lobby. However, within 20 minutes the room was ready, and I was on the way to a really nice week-long stay. Although I prefer the Marriott Waterfront Seattle for sheer luxury, I chose the Residence Inn to take advantage of the space, cooking, laundry and other extended-stay amenities. The hotel is located on the southern shore of Lake Union about 15 minutes from the UW campus and next door to the Seattle Cancer Care Alliance. Tram and bus stops are right in front of the hotel, so even without a car, you can get just about anywhere in and around central Seattle easily. Parking in the hotel's underground garage is $19/night, although this drops to $7 for stays of over 30 days. I had stayed here about six years ago, and I was pleased to find the Residence Inn has been refurbished recently. The place is huge with seven floors and over 230 suites, 40 of which are two-bedroom units. I believe most, if not all suites, have small balconies. Each features a kitchen with a two-burner cook tops, a microwave, a large refrigerator, and a dishwasher. A small dining table divides the kitchen from the living area with a couch (fold-out bed), easy chair, flat-screen TV, coffee table, and computer desk. Internet is free in each room. My suite had a large master bedroom with king-size bed and another TV as well as an adjacent dressing area and bathroom with shower and tub. Breakfast is complimentary. On Sunday and Monday morning, the kitchen simply could not keep up with the demand, and finding edible morsels was like harvesting after a swarm of locusts had passed. However, most of the time it was no problem. Seating is throughout the central atrium, which can be noisy, although you can take your food back to your room, of course. Wednesday night features a manager's reception with tasty food from one of the local eateries. While I was there, Azteca featured Mexican food at the reception with a cash bar. Coffee and tea are free and are on 24/7. The Residence Inn offers grocery shopping service if you can't find your way to one of the local supermarkets. Also, there are frozen and freeze-dried foods and other staples available for purchase in the lobby. Many good restaurants ring Lake Union, too, so you should never be without a decent choice for a meal, even if you have to walk a few blocks or take a short taxi ride. Staff are universally friendly, and housekeeping appears to be quite efficient, despite my initial thoughts. Each day the housekeeper arrived at my room promptly between 9 and 9:30 AM, so I had to shoo her away on a couple of occasions. The Residence Inn at Lake Union is an ideal hotel for short or long stays, particularly for independent travelers and those with families, pets, or special needs. You can save a lot by not dining out every night, and given the level of comfort, I think this hotel rates among one of the best values in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lake Union Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: Rocklover19
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 spent 5 nights here in August. It is a great location with beautiful views of Lake Union. It is in a great central location so many attractions are close and easy to get to. We were just minutes away from the space needle, Pikes market, the ferry service and the great sports stadiums. The room was large and very clean. It had a beautiful, large balcony with comfortable chairs. It has a very nice kitchen area with everything you need including a dishwasher. The pool was nice, we used it everyday. The breakfast was free with many choices, just not the best tasting choices. The staff was very friendly and had maps to anyplace you needed to go. I loved Seattle and would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit All Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: BarbO45
Reviews.Content: We just loved this location and all this hotel had to offer. We are 60+ and would definitely recommend for families and our own age group. Room overlooked the lake and yachts which included good restaurants and short walk to others. Offered us a discount because we had just come off (or embarking) on a cruise ship out of Seattle. Breakfast buffet is a cut above others for offerings/selections. Trolley stop is less than 1/2 block away to get you downtown - not a real inconvenience considering the prices of downtown hotels. All staff very accommodating - we would go back "in a heartbeat."

Reviews.Title: “Happy choice”
Reviews.Author: Toton-traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in mid august with reward points. It was an unusual residence inn, looking more like an embassy suites internally, but the 2 bed suite we had was lovely, obviously newly renovated and really nicely furnished, plus great LCD TV's. The hotel is in a nice location looking over Lake Union, and not too far from the centre of Seattle, (long walk or short drive). The hotel is on a busy corner and road noise was sometimes very obvious but wouldn't put me off staying again. The breakfast area was very busy and seemed too small really to cope with the number of people grabbing their free grub. There was only one 'managers reception' rather than the usual mon-thurs. No matter, the suites were really comfortable and homey and we enjoyed our stay despite the small shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Good take”
Reviews.Author: RedsoxFan41
Reviews.Content: This is a bit out of Pike's Peak area, but a good take for a family. We were able to get a nice Suite for less than the cost of two rooms downtown. The hotel is on a trolley line that runs downtown very quickly and frequently. There is a cove across the street with three good restaurants - Duke's Chowder house is a good casual call. Buca di Beppo is a fun Italian place three blocks away. Hotel has a gym (sort of lame, but there), pool, and business center. The include breakfast is very complete - eggs, oatmeal, etc - not simply rolls and coffee. Not the best take for a business traveler who needs to be downtown, but it was a great fit for our family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueen48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for leisure with some friends and the hotel was so beautiful inside. It had a indoor pool and the front desk gal was so helpful. She went out of her way to find us what club to go to and even called the cab for us and gathered directions. The only bad thing is the parking. Not enough. The suite was so spacious and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for a family of four (w/ two teenagers)”
Reviews.Author: TwinOaksMd
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed three nights in a suite with a mini-kitchen. The facilities were very good, we enjoyed the full breakfast. Although not centrally located, the hotel is a convenient trolley ride from downtown. Fine views of Lake Union and its float planes and kayak rentals. Check out the Wooden Boat Center, there is a peaceful dock to sit out on in the evening. It is also a modest walk from the main REI store and a couple food markets. One issue: the bathroom was located inside the bedroom, so the kids had to enter our bedroom to reach the bathroom during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: HawkRidgeVA
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 11-year-olds) were very happy with a 1-bedroom, lakeview suite in this hotel. Like most Residence Inn's, we had a good basic kitchen, a smallish living room with pull-out couch, and a very comfortable bedroom. The furnishings are more modern, and good-looking, than most Res. Inns. The location on the lake is great with nice restaurants across the street (we loved the chowder at Duke's) and views of seaplanes taking off and landing. We did not have a car and it was easy to get downtown on the rail line. If we return to Seattle we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peninsulatraveler2
Reviews.Content: This very clean, updated, spacious one bedroom suite was comfortable and you had everything you needed. The location was great, over-looking Lake Union and the breakfast is a full breakfast not just muffins, yogurt and coffee. The street car is about a block away that will get you to the downtown area for great restaurants and shopping for a very reasonable price. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. This hotel is like a home away from home; my husband and I spent one night, we wished we had more time to enjoy. You can't go wrong staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeled Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: Bizztravel
Reviews.Content: I just completed a 4 day stay. Nicely renovated rooms with 32 inch LCD TVs. Two in my suite, with a view overlooking Lake Union. I paid a $174 company rate which was cheap relative to other comparable hotels in downtown Seattle. It is not the closest hotel to Pike's market or the 1st Ave restaurants. I got tire of walking around, but there are several nice restaurants within a block or two along Lake Union. Breakfast was same as any Residence Inn. Wednesday, they have a happy hour with full Mexican food. Tacos, enchiladas, beer, wine, chips. Nothing on any other nights. Parking was $19. I had a rental SUV to park, and parking in their secure lot is very, very tight. If someone parks next to you, you are going to need a crowbar to pry yourself into your car.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkLChicago
Reviews.Content: I had a one bedroom suite over looking Lake Union. Beautiful view, with the sea planes taking off and landing, the marina and kayaker in the water. The hotel was very quiet and clean. Many people from all over the world are staying here and the staff treated everyone with the same care. The breakfast is good, but get there before the closing time, as when they say it ends at 9am, they mean it. Parking is $19 a day, but that is cheaper then almost any other hotel in the area. Accept the fact you WILL pay for parking everywhere in Seattle. Down by the piers, I paid $35 for all day parking. The parking at the hotel is secured and underground, so you will never get wet. (It never rained for the 2 weeks I was there).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, and value”
Reviews.Author: sophisticato
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with extended family or even on your own. The rooms are nicely decorated and beds very comfortable. Love the open space in the middle where breakfast is served and great place to meet for business. The new tram stop is a short walk away and great way to get downtown. Love the location by Lake Union. Seems a bit safer than downtown. The staff were most helpful and loved the help yourself coffee. Lots of restaurants on the wharf. Also, on Wed evenings they feature a Seattle chef and complimentary drinks too. Large rooms, clean, reasonably priced, and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: southms
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location (just like most all of the reviewers have said!). The decor is much nicer than any other Residence Inn I've ever stayed. We had a room on the 6th floor with a large balcony overlooking Lake Union, unbelievable view! The room was so spacious with 2 large bedrooms, 2 baths, kitchen, dining and living areas. Three nice large (new) TVs. The free breakfast was a nice amenity and tasted good. Overall, we found the emps to be very helpful and friendly with one exception (Whitney). They use a car service called Cameo Town Car that we used quite a bit to get to and from the airport as well as to the wharfs and other attractions. They were extremely reliable and reasonable. Overall, it might be the best place in town to stay (as long as you can get the lake view!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BearAndPenguin
Reviews.Content: The suites in the Residence Inn were newly renovated, spacious, comfortable and clean. The hotel has a huge lobby which is nice for just hanging out in. I had all of my wedding guests stay in the hotel and everyone loved it. The location is nice because it is right on the bus line and streetcar line and minutes from downtown Seattle without being right in the middle of the busy downtown. It is also right next Lake Union and half the rooms have a great view. The breakfast was good but not great - I have liked the breakfast at Embassy Suites more. The staff was okay, not the friendliest ever, but they did do everything that was asked of them. Parking is $19/day which is expensive, but not for Seattle. Other downtown hotels charge $40/night. There are also restaurants right across the street so you don't need to drive anywhere to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler23
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early June with 3 small children. The hotel is in a good location directly across from Lake Union, a small park is across the street and a boardwalk around the Marina is a good distraction for kids to release some energy. Seattle Center is a short 15 mintue walk although be careful of which route you take, some roads have small sides walks with heavy traffic. Easy access to I-5 to get to other sites in the area. Breakfast was average but what can you expect for free! Indoor pool was a little small but the kids had a great time. Rooms were very nice as the hotel was recently renovated, staff was helpful with basic information but did lack more detailed information about things to do. 3 sit down restaurants across the street (Hooter's, Joey's and Daniel's Broiler) nice for adults but not that appropriate for kids and there are few other kid friendly restaurants close (not that I could find). No hotel bar or restaurant on site. Parking is $19/day and you have no options close by. I would recommend the hotel especially with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mkabell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated by Lake Union near the end of the street car line from down town. That location is fine (but could Seattle please extend the hours that the street car runs...). Rooms were fine, although the bathroom and toilet was strangely separated from the sink and towels. Nice bed, though. Internet was free - or did they just forget to charge me? - but only wired connections. A Marriott should have free wi-fi as well. My rate included breakfast, but I only had the stomach to eat it once. It is terrible. Fruit juices are the synthetic kind, the choices of fruit is VERY limited and mixed together in a bowl with some strangetasting liquid. Eggs are served in a block (!), sausages are in fact patties - and there are so very few healthy options. Don't stay here if you care for the food you eat - it is not worth it. Oh, I almost forgot: The Starbucks coffee you can get was cold most of the time I got to get a cup - or empty...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel as part of a package for an extended weekend in Seattle. To start with, the location is great, right on Lake Union near several restaurants, downtown, the Space Needle, etc. We had a car but you could probably do without if needed. The light rail and busses run right by the hotel and take you all over the city with frequent and easy access. If you do have a car, the hotel charges $19 to park in their secured garage or you can find metered street parking for less than half (which we did with no problems). The hotel has recently been remodeled and the rooms are some of the best I have seen for this brand. Very roomy, nice décor, nicely equipped modern kitchens, great comfortable bed, plenty of drawer and closet space, large flat screen tvs in both the bedroom and living areas. It is easy to spread out and even have a little privacy if you have more than a couple of you. For the working types, there is a nice work area with free high speed internet and comfortable desk and chair. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. The hotel does appear to cater to families (and allows the family pet too which you see many of so that may or may not be OK with you). The hotel is busy and sometimes elevators and such are slow due to this but while the hotel was quite full, we never heard our neighbors (the lobby was a buzz but the rooms were quiet). We had a room that faced the back (not the lake) but this was fine and quiet. The lake side actually is along a fairly busy street so it has a little more noise but you get the views of the marinas, seaplanes, etc. I ran one morning along the lake which was great and I felt safe (and saw other runners out). Of course exercise caution since it’s a mix of nice residential, commercial, industrial and some transient all in the area but overall you should be fine to walk to local places, etc. They gym has decent equipment (but not a lot of it). A couple treadmills, a couple elliptical’s, one bike and some weights (barbells and a universal weight machine). The gym area is small and gets crowded and a little stuffy (indoor right by the pool) but if you go off –hours you should have no problem. They have an indoor pool and spa which is great for the kids and have adult only swimming hours also (later in the evening). The breakfast is extensive but busy. There are also some great restaurants within walking distance offering all kinds of cuisine and many with outdoor patios onto the lake. Nothing beats having a drink or bite on the lake front on a sunny day in Seattle. I would definitely stay here again, loved the location, the room and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Seattle with a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Complete_Travel
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn Lake Union is a great Seattle hotel. It was so nice being in the city, but with a view of Lake Union. We had a lake view room and really enjoyed watching the sea planes land and take off. Chandlers Restaurant across the street has wonderful seafood (it is a little pricey, but worth it). The on going renovations were no problem as they made every effort to keep the noise and disturbance down. The room had a king bed with separate living room with sofa bed, and a full kitchen (minus an oven). The front desk staff was helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: onedude
Reviews.Content: This recently rennovated Residence Inn by Marriott is of a very high standard on Lake Union, close to downtown Seattle. We arrived here after departing Vancouver, Canada ahead of schedule. The staff at checkin were warm and accommodating, Zara in particular continued to offer an excpetionally high level of service for my queries at the front desk over the coming days. I was so impressed I wrote a letter of commendation to the hotel GM, not something I often do. Residence Inn generally promote at least 50% more space than a normal hotel room - Room 720 had a separate bedroom, bathroom, and combined kitchen/living space complete with complimentary wired internet and a hot, cooked breakfast every morning. I especially loved the flat screen TV in both the lounge and bedroom, and the full size fridge which allowed us to shop at the Safeway (about 2 miles away) and stock up on some comfort food and drinks during our four night stay. The furnishings were all new or meticulously maintained, and the signature Marriott bedding was exceptionally comfortable was one would expect. I slept well in this hotel, and put it down to the warm red color feature wall behind the bed, and the blackout curtains. It was even inviting to crawl back into the bed for an afternoon nap! The only thing I found to be a negative with the hotel was the nightly USD19 parking fee - yes I understand a lot of hotels charge a fee, but this hotel is not truly "downtown" and non secure lots in the area charge around USD10 per day. Perhaps it is something the hotel could consider including as part of the rate. The hotel is apparently undergoing rennovation - we could see some plastic sheeting up on the first floor, but we were never bothered by dust or noise. Overall, an exceptional experience and a hotel I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Floridalynn28
Reviews.Content: Seattle is a great city and the hotel was a delight. We were hoping to be closer to the Seattle Center but this location turned out to be perfect for us. The suite had just been renovated. It was well designed with a comfy bed. We had a view of the Space Needle and watched seaplanes and boats from our balcony. The staff was always pleasant and assisted with arrangements for a car to take us to the airport. Public transportation is right out the front door as well as fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: teefisch
Reviews.Content: I just had a very pleasant five night stay at this hotel. The lobby area is somewhat off-putting (very beige and kind of depressing), but the newly refinished rooms on the 6th ant 7th floors are very nice. I enjoy having a kitchen, but although the hotel claims that the in-room kitchens are full kitchens, they really only have a microwave, fridge, dishwasher and two tiny burners. No full-sized burners and no ovens! Also, unlike other Residence Inns that I have stayed at, this one only offers "evening snack" on Wednesdays, as opposed to Mon-Thurs. And, unless you specifically ask, your sheets won't be changed--mine weren't changed at all during my stay. That being said, if you are looking for a safe, quiet hotel in a rather sedate location (there's not much shopping, dining or nightlife within 1/2 mile of this hotel) this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice location”
Reviews.Author: AndrewHHH
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Residence Inn. I really like this place and the location in Lake Union, and when using Priceline I now always hope to get this hotel. Although the hotel is currently being renovated, this didn't bother me in the least - they work only 8-5 anyway. Otherwise it's a very comfortable hotel. Last time I didn't have a car but found it easy to get around - there are buses nearby (you can use Google's transit site for easy mapping of routes from, say, King Street Station - Amtrak - to the hotel) and now there's a tram that runs from almost in front of the hotel into downtown. But you can walk to Seattle Center, Queen Anne, etc. or even downtown very easily if you are in good walking shape. This time I had a car and had remembered street parking was free - but if it was before, now all parking on streets adjacent to the hotel is pay-to-park, with "parking machines." As of this writing it's 75 cents/hour (cheaper than elsewhere in Seattle) and there are 10-hour spots adjacent to the hotel where you can park all day (free Sundays and holidays). But you have to get out there at 8am to pay for that day's parking. Next time I'd probably park in the lot for $20/night, given the last reviewer's observation that car windows had been smashed (there was still broken glass on the street when I parked there a few weeks later). But you don't really need a car if you are staying here and limiting yourself to the core Seattle sites, if you use the tram and bus or walk to things, use the occasional taxi. Hotel has free wired internet in the room if you have a laptop (they supply the ethernet cable). Worked great for me.

Reviews.Title: “great seattle spot”
Reviews.Author: happpycamper
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here, both times for the Seattle boat show. It's a perfect location for that, but also great for other Seattle desitinations, especially since the trolly stops in front of the hotel and takes you downtown where you can walk or take the monorail to Seattle Center. The breakfast is well above average, rooms are spacious, nice to have a kitchen and coffee is always available in the lobby. We are very picky about coffee and found theirs to be well above average. There are many nice resturants, Joeys, Dukes chowder House were quite good. Only negative were the beds were quite soft for us, but would not stop a return visit. The parking is about $10 less than downtown hotels. Even though they are renovating, there wasn't excessive noise or inconvenience. Also, don't pay extra for a "water view", isn't really isn't much.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for families - but think twice about street parking”
Reviews.Author: Invisiblezipper
Reviews.Content: Our family (including 2 boys under 3 and a dog) stayed at the Lake Union Residence Inn this past weekend. Every staff person we met was very friendly and accommodating. Though we didn't book a "view room" (more expensive), we were upgraded when we arrived and our boys enjoyed watching the boats and seaplanes on the lake and the streetcar down below. We took full advantage of the kitchen as well as the robust continental breakfast. Our room on the 5th floor hadn't been renovated yet but was very comfortable and clean. The king bed was so comfortable, with a nice variety of pillows. We got a rollaway bed for our oldest son and even that bed was comfortable - often rollaways are of the fold up variety and are miserable to sleep on. This was an actual twin bed on wheels with the same linens and comfortable pillows as our bed. The hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant (no room service) but several restaurants (like Outback) offer delivery. The restaurants in the area are either seafood (across the street) or chain restaurants (outback, bucca de beppo). Belltown, with many cool local restaurants and coffee shops, is an easy drive or a 20 minute walk. Since our boys wake up really early (5 a.m.), we really liked the fact that the pool opens at 5 a.m. It was a way to keep the kids occupied and away from the room so that we didn't disturb other guests who were probably sleeping. There is a deep pool, a small kids pool (3 ft) a dry sauna and a hot tub. We opted to park on the street behind the hotel - the meter costs about $10 for the whole day as opposed to $20 in the hotel garage. The area around the hotel is all commercial (a public storage, cancer treatment center, day care center) so the streets were completely empty on the weekend. That's great for finding parking but probably not so great for security purposes. The Saturday night we were there, all the cars parked on the street had their windows shattered - probably about 12 cars in total. We just happened to be at a friend's house on Saturday night so our car wasn't hit. I have no idea what the hotel did for the owners of the cars.
